Commissurotomy, Consciousness, and Unity.title: Commissurotomy, Consciousness, and Unity of Mind
Commissurotomy, Consciousness, and Unity.author: Charles Marks
Commissurotomy, Consciousness, and Unity.summary: "That the split brain case is philosophically perplexing is undeniable; a description of the experiments of Sperry and others strikes not only philosophers but philosophy students and laymen as raising significant issues about what it is to have a single mind."

1984\tGeorge Orwell.author: George Orwell
1984\tGeorge Orwell.summary: "Novel by George Orwell, a warning about the menaces of totalitarianism. The novel is set in an imaginary future world that is dominated by three perpetually warring totalitarian police states."
reviews: "I recent­ly reread this book and was impressed by its visionary quality. Orwell’s thinking is implacable, unraveling our desires for freedom as well as our craving for power. This capacity to dive into the very essence of man makes 1984 timeless."
"[What are the three best books you've ever read?]"

The Accidental Superpower: The Next Gene.title: The Accidental Superpower: The Next Generation of American Preeminence and the Coming Global Disorder
The Accidental Superpower: The Next Gene.author: Peter Zeihan
The Accidental Superpower: The Next Gene.summary: "International strategist Peter Zeihan examines how the hard rules of geography are eroding the American commitment to free trade; how much of the planet is aging into a mass retirement that will enervate markets and capital supplies; and how, against all odds, it is the ever-ravenous American economy that-alone among the developed nations-is rapidly approaching energy independence."

Act of Congress: How America's Essential.title: Act of Congress: How America's Essential Institution Works, and How It Doesn't
Act of Congress: How America's Essential.author: Robert Kaiser
Act of Congress: How America's Essential.summary: "An eye-opening account of how Congress today really works—and how it doesn’t—that follows the dramatic journey of the sweeping financial reform bill enacted in response to the Great Crash of 2008."

Age of Ambition: Chasing Fortune, Truth,.title: Age of Ambition: Chasing Fortune, Truth, and Faith in the New China
Age of Ambition: Chasing Fortune, Truth,.author: Evan Osnos
Age of Ambition: Chasing Fortune, Truth,.summary: "Osnos describes the greatest collision taking place in [China]: the clash between the rise of the individual and the Communist Party's struggle to retain control."

The Alchemist\tPaul Coelho.title: The Alchemist
The Alchemist\tPaul Coelho.author: Paul Coelho
The Alchemist\tPaul Coelho.summary: "Paulo Coelho's masterpiece tells the magical story of Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy who yearns to travel in search of a worldly treasure as extravagant as any ever found."

The Alliance: Managing Talent in the Net.title: The Alliance: Managing Talent in the Networked Age
The Alliance: Managing Talent in the Net.author: Reid Hoffman
The Alliance: Managing Talent in the Net.summary: "The employer-employee relationship is broken, and managers face a seemingly impossible dilemma: the old model of guaranteed long-term employment no longer works in a business environment defined by continuous change, but neither does a system in which every employee acts like a free agent."

America in Retreat: The New Isolationism.title: America in Retreat: The New Isolationism and the Coming Global Disorder
America in Retreat: The New Isolationism.author: Bret Stephens
America in Retreat: The New Isolationism.summary: "America in Retreat identifies a profound crisis on the global horizon. As Americans seek to withdraw from the world to tend to domestic problems, America’s adversaries spy opportunity."

The Anatomy of Human Destructiveness\tEr.title: The Anatomy of Human Destructiveness
The Anatomy of Human Destructiveness\tEr.author: Erich Fromm
The Anatomy of Human Destructiveness\tEr.summary: "In this provocative book, the distinguished author writes to break the deadlock in the struggle between the instinctivism of Konrad Lorenz and behavior psychologist B.F. Skinner."

The Archaic Revival: Speculations on Psy.title: The Archaic Revival: Speculations on Psychedelic Mushrooms, the Amazon, Virtual Reality, UFOs, Evolution, Shamanism, the Rebirth of the Goddess, and the End of History
The Archaic Revival: Speculations on Psy.author: Terence McKenna
The Archaic Revival: Speculations on Psy.summary: "McKenna takes us on a mesmerizing journey deep into the Amazon as well as into the hidden recesses of the human psyche and the outer limits of our culture, giving us startling visions of the past and future."

Art and Illusion: A Study in the Psychol.title: Art and Illusion: A Study in the Psychology of Pictorial Representation
Art and Illusion: A Study in the Psychol.author: Ernst Gombrich
Art and Illusion: A Study in the Psychol.summary: "Art and Illusion examines the history and psychology of pictorial representation in light of present-day theories of visual perception information and learning."

The Art of Meditation\tJoel S. Goldsmith.title: The Art of Meditation
The Art of Meditation\tJoel S. Goldsmith.author: Joel S. Goldsmith
The Art of Meditation\tJoel S. Goldsmith.summary: "This classic, bestselling introduction to a regular program of daily meditation defines meditation's vital role in spiritual living, and features careful instructions, illustrative examples, and specially written meditations."

The Art of the Novel\tMilan Kundera.title: The Art of the Novel
The Art of the Novel\tMilan Kundera.author: Milan Kundera
The Art of the Novel\tMilan Kundera.summary: "Kundera brilliantly examines the work of such important and diverse figures as Rabelais, Cervantes, Sterne, Diderot, Flaubert, Tolstoy, and Musil. He is especially penetrating on Hermann Broch, and his exploration of the world of Kafka's novels vividly reveals the comic terror of Kafka's bureaucratized universe."

The Astonishing Hypothesis: The Scientif.title: The Astonishing Hypothesis: The Scientific Search for the Soul
The Astonishing Hypothesis: The Scientif.author: Francis Crick
The Astonishing Hypothesis: The Scientif.summary: "Nobel Laureate Francis Crick boldly straddles the line between science and spirituality by examining the soul from the standpoint of a modern scientist, basing the soul's existence and function on an in-depth examination of how the human brain 'sees'."

The Atomic Bazaar: Dispatches from the U.title: The Atomic Bazaar: Dispatches from the Underground World of Nuclear Trafficking
The Atomic Bazaar: Dispatches from the U.author: William Langewiesche
The Atomic Bazaar: Dispatches from the U.summary: "William Langewiesche investigates the burgeoning global threat of nuclear weapons production. This is the story of the inexorable drift of nuclear weapons technology from the hands of the rich into the hands of the poor."

Automate This: How Algorithms Came to Ru.title: Automate This: How Algorithms Came to Rule Our World
Automate This: How Algorithms Came to Ru.author: Christopher Steiner
Automate This: How Algorithms Came to Ru.summary: "Christopher Steiner tells the story of how algorithms took over—and shows why the 'bot revolution' is about to spill into every aspect of our lives, often silently, without our knowledge."

Autonomous Technology: Technics-out-of-C.title: Autonomous Technology: Technics-out-of-Control as a Theme in Political Thought
Autonomous Technology: Technics-out-of-C.author: Langdon Winner
Autonomous Technology: Technics-out-of-C.summary: "The contemporary experience of things technological has repeatedly confounded our vision, our expectations, and our capacity to make intelligent judgments. Categories, arguments, conclusions, and choices that would have been entirely obvious in earlier times are obvious no longer."
reviews: "Winner brought the sensitivity of a political theorist concerned with questions of democratic control over technologies, and the control of those who are in power over technologies, to the debate."

Awareness: The Perils and Opportunities.title: Awareness: The Perils and Opportunities of Reality
Awareness: The Perils and Opportunities.author: Anthony De Mello
Awareness: The Perils and Opportunities.summary: "The heart of Anthony de Mello's bestselling spiritual message is awareness. Mixing Christian spirituality, Buddhist parables, Hindu breathing exercises, and psychological insight, de Mello's words of hope come together in Awareness in a grand synthesis."

Barchester Towers \tAnthony Trollope.title: Barchester Towers
Barchester Towers \tAnthony Trollope.author: Anthony Trollope
Barchester Towers \tAnthony Trollope.summary: "Barchester Towers chronicles the struggles for power and position in an imaginary county in Victorian England."
reviews: "It has a great cast of wonderfully drawn characters and is very funny."

The Baron in the Trees\tItalo Calvino.title: The Baron in the Trees
The Baron in the Trees\tItalo Calvino.author: Italo Calvino
The Baron in the Trees\tItalo Calvino.summary: "Cosimo, a young eighteenth-century Italian nobleman, rebels by climbing into the trees to remain there for the rest of his life. He adapts efficiently to an arboreal existence and even has love affairs."
reviews: "A delightful and tremendously enjoyable little novel on boyhood defiance."

Bartleby, the Scrivener: A Story of Wall.title: Bartleby, the Scrivener: A Story of Wall Street
Bartleby, the Scrivener: A Story of Wall.author: Herman Melville
Bartleby, the Scrivener: A Story of Wall.summary: "A Wall Street lawyer hires a new clerk who—after an initial bout of hard work—refuses to make copy and any other task required of him, with the words 'I would prefer not to'."
reviews: "I am still amazed by Melville's ability to create characters in a few quick strokes. His tale of Bartleby, first described as 'pallidly neat, pitiably respectable, incurably forlorn,' is one of those literary miracles that should be read rather than talked about."

A Beautiful Question: Finding Nature's D.title: A Beautiful Question: Finding Nature's Deep Design
A Beautiful Question: Finding Nature's D.author: Frank Wilczek
A Beautiful Question: Finding Nature's D.summary: "Wilczek brings us right to the edge of knowledge today, where the core insights of even the craziest quantum ideas apply principles we all understand. The equations for atoms and light are almost literally the same equations that govern musical instruments and sound; the subatomic particles that are responsible for most of our mass are determined by simple geometric symmetries."

Before the Dawn: Recovering the Lost His.title: Before the Dawn: Recovering the Lost History of Our Ancestors
Before the Dawn: Recovering the Lost His.author: Nicholas Wade
Before the Dawn: Recovering the Lost His.summary: "In his groundbreaking Before the Dawn, Wade reveals humanity’s origins as never before—a journey made possible only recently by genetic science, whose incredible findings have answered such questions as: What was the first human language like? How large were the first societies, and how warlike were they?"

Beloved\tToni Morrison.title: Beloved
Beloved\tToni Morrison.author: Toni Morrison
Beloved\tToni Morrison.summary: "Staring unflinchingly into the abyss of slavery, this spellbinding novel transforms history into a story as powerful as Exodus and as intimate as a lullaby. Sethe, its protagonist, was born a slave and escaped to Ohio, but eighteen years later she is still not free."
reviews: “The author looks unflinchingly at the catastrophic with grace and dignity.”

Benjamin Franklin\tWalter Isaacson.title: Benjamin Franklin
Benjamin Franklin\tWalter Isaacson.author: Walter Isaacson
Benjamin Franklin\tWalter Isaacson.summary: "In this authoritative and engrossing full-scale biography, Walter Isaacson, bestselling author of Einstein and Steve Jobs, shows how the most fascinating of America's founders helped define our national character."
reviews: "You can see how [Franklin] was an entrepreneur. He started from nothing. He was just a runaway kid."

Birth of a Theorem: A Mathematical Adven.title: Birth of a Theorem: A Mathematical Adventure
Birth of a Theorem: A Mathematical Adven.author: Cedric Villani
Birth of a Theorem: A Mathematical Adven.summary: "In 2010, French mathematician Cedric Villani received the Fields Medal, the most coveted prize in mathematics, in recognition of a proof which he devised with his close collaborator Clement Mouhot to explain one of the most surprising theories in classical physics. Birth of a Thorem is Villani's own account of the years leading up to the award."
reviews: "This is a gem for a singular reason. One sees exactly how Villani (or a pure mathematician) goes from abstract to abstract without ever exiting the world of pure and symbolic mathematics, even though the subject concerns a very concrete real-world topic."

Black Holes and Time Warps: Einstein's O.title: Black Holes and Time Warps: Einstein's Outrageous Legacy
Black Holes and Time Warps: Einstein's O.author: Kip S. Thorne
Black Holes and Time Warps: Einstein's O.summary: "Ever since Albert Einstein's general theory of relativity burst upon the world in 1915 some of the most brilliant minds of our century have sought to decipher the mysteries bequeathed by that theory, a legacy so unthinkable in some respects that even Einstein himself rejected them."

Blasphemy: How the Religious Right is Hi.title: Blasphemy: How the Religious Right is Hijacking
Blasphemy: How the Religious Right is Hi.author: Alan Dershowitz
Blasphemy: How the Religious Right is Hi.summary: "In Blasphemy: How the Religious Right is Hijacking the Declaration of Independence, author Alan Dershowitz proves that no relation exists between the Declaration of Independence’s Creator and Nature’s God, on the one hand, and the Judeo-Christian God of the Old and New Testaments, on the other hand."

The Blind Owl\tSadegh Hedayat.title: The Blind Owl
The Blind Owl\tSadegh Hedayat.author: Sadegh Hedayat
The Blind Owl\tSadegh Hedayat.summary: "The story is narrated by a young man, a painter of miniatures, whose name is never given. He feels an overbearing need to recount an experience he went through that has shattered his whole existence. A beautiful woman, an old man and a cypress tree are the recurring motifs."
reviews: "Widely recognized as one of the most important literary works of the 20th century in any language, The Blind Owl is a Kafkaesque novel about a lonely (and possibly psychotic) man living in a terrifying nightmare world of his own making, where the only person he can trust with his thoughts is his own shadow."

The Blind Watchmaker: Why the Evidence o.title: The Blind Watchmaker: Why the Evidence of Evolution Reveals a Universe without Design
The Blind Watchmaker: Why the Evidence o.author: Richard Dawkins
The Blind Watchmaker: Why the Evidence o.summary: "Natural selection―the unconscious, automatic, blind, yet essentially nonrandom process Darwin discovered―has no purpose in mind. If it can be said to play the role of a watchmaker in nature, it is the blind watchmaker in nature."
reviews: “A lucid explanation of natural selection and a model of elegant science writing.”

Bloodlands: Europe Between Hitler and St.title: Bloodlands: Europe Between Hitler and Stalin
Bloodlands: Europe Between Hitler and St.author: Timothy Snyder
Bloodlands: Europe Between Hitler and St.summary: "Bloodlands is a new kind of European history, presenting the mass murders committed by the Nazi and Stalinist regimes as two aspects of a single history, in the time and place where they occurred: between Germany and Russia, when Hitler and Stalin both held power."

The Bodhisattva’s Brain: Buddhism Natura.title: The Bodhisattva’s Brain: Buddhism Naturalized
The Bodhisattva’s Brain: Buddhism Natura.author: Owen Flanagan
The Bodhisattva’s Brain: Buddhism Natura.summary: "In The Bodhisattva's Brain, Flanagan argues that it is possible to discover in Buddhism a rich, empirically responsible philosophy that could point us to one path of human flourishing."

The Bonobo and the Atheist: In Search of.title: The Bonobo and the Atheist: In Search of Humanism Among the Primates
The Bonobo and the Atheist: In Search of.author: Frans de Waal
The Bonobo and the Atheist: In Search of.summary: "In this lively and illuminating discussion of his landmark research, esteemed primatologist Frans de Waal argues that human morality is not imposed from above but instead comes from within. Moral behavior does not begin and end with religion but is in fact a product of evolution."

Brain Bugs: How the Brain's Flaws Shape.title: Brain Bugs: How the Brain's Flaws Shape Our Lives
Brain Bugs: How the Brain's Flaws Shape.author: Dean Buonomano
Brain Bugs: How the Brain's Flaws Shape.summary: "Whether explaining why we are susceptible to advertisements or demonstrating how false memories are formed, Brain Bugs not only explains the brain’s inherent flaws but also gives us the tools to counteract them."

Brecht on Theatre: The Development of an.title: Brecht on Theatre: The Development of an Aesthetic
Brecht on Theatre: The Development of an.author: Bertolt Brecht
Brecht on Theatre: The Development of an.summary: "Here, arranged in chronological order, are essays from 1918 to 1956, in which Brecht explores his definition of the Epic Theatre and his theory of alienation-effects in directing, acting, and writing, and discusses, among other works, The Threepenny Opera, Mahagonny, Mother Courage, Puntila, and Galileo."
reviews: "Brecht was a German playwright who developed something called the alienation effect. His idea was that people shouldn't be wrapped up in the plot of a play; rather, they should be made conscious of the fact that they are watching a play all the time. Only then will they have the presence of mind to consider actions to take in the real world."

A Brief History of Time\tStephen Hawking.title: A Brief History of Time
A Brief History of Time\tStephen Hawking.author: Stephen Hawking
A Brief History of Time\tStephen Hawking.summary: "A landmark volume in science writing by one of the great minds of our time, Stephen Hawking’s book explores such profound questions as: How did the universe begin—and what made its start possible? Does time always flow forward?"

The Brothers Karamazov\tFyodor Dostoevsk.title: The Brothers Karamazov
The Brothers Karamazov\tFyodor Dostoevsk.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
The Brothers Karamazov\tFyodor Dostoevsk.summary: "The Brothers Karamazov is a passionate philosophical novel set in 19th century Russia, that enters deeply into the ethical debates of God, free will, and morality. It is a spiritual drama of moral struggles concerning faith, doubt, judgement, and reason, set against a modernizing Russia, with a plot which revolves around the subject of patricide."
reviews: "Indispensable to me (both as a reader and as a writer)"

Bull: A History of the Boom and Bust, 19.title: Bull: A History of the Boom and Bust, 1982-2004
Bull: A History of the Boom and Bust, 19.author: Maggie Mahar
Bull: A History of the Boom and Bust, 19.summary: "This inside look at [a] 17-year cycle of growth, built upon interviews and unparalleled access to the most important analysts, market observers, and fund managers who eagerly tell the tales of excesses, presents the period with a historical perspective and explains what really happened and why."
reviews: "Maggie Mahar had the courage to take a look at what was behind all of this religious belief in markets."

Bull by the Horns: Fighting to Save Main.title: Bull by the Horns: Fighting to Save Main Street from Wall Street and Wall Street from Itself
Bull by the Horns: Fighting to Save Main.author: Sheila Bair
Bull by the Horns: Fighting to Save Main.summary: "The former FDIC chairwoman, and one of the first people to acknowledge the full risk of subprime loans, offers a unique perspective on the financial crisis."
reviews: "When history is written, this will be used, not the spin by the bankers’ slaves and soldiers (Geithner, Rubin et al.) Bravo Sheila!"

Capital: Critique of Political Economy\t.title: Capital: Critique of Political Economy
Capital: Critique of Political Economy\t.author: Karl Marx
Capital: Critique of Political Economy\t.summary: "Marx [aims] to reveal the economic patterns underpinning the capitalist mode of production, in contrast to classical political economists such as Adam Smith, David Ricardo and John Stuart Mill."
reviews: "Marx was the first — and best — at understanding the economy as a system that not only is informed by existing power relationships but also reinforces them."

Capitol Punishment: The Hard Truth About.title: Capitol Punishment: The Hard Truth About Washington Corruption From America's Most Notorious Lobbyist
Capitol Punishment: The Hard Truth About.author: Jack Abramoff
Capitol Punishment: The Hard Truth About.summary: "[This] book details the author′s life in Washington as a power broker and lobbyist. In its last chapter, Abramoff lists a number of proposals to eliminate bribery of government officials."

The Case for Israel\tAlan Dershowitz.title: The Case for Israel
The Case for Israel\tAlan Dershowitz.author: Alan Dershowitz
The Case for Israel\tAlan Dershowitz.summary: "The Case for Israel is an ardent defense of Israel's rights, supported by indisputable evidence."

The Castle\tFranz Kafka.title: The Castle
The Castle\tFranz Kafka.author: Franz Kafka
The Castle\tFranz Kafka.summary: "Left unfinished by Kafka in 1922 and not published until 1926, two years after his death, The Castle is the haunting tale of K.’s relentless, unavailing struggle with an inscrutable authority in order to gain access to the Castle."
reviews: "It was a great big incredible book. It gave me a tremendous shock."

The Catcher in the Rye\tJD Salinger.title: The Catcher in the Rye
The Catcher in the Rye\tJD Salinger.author: JD Salinger
The Catcher in the Rye\tJD Salinger.summary: "The hero-narrator [...] is an ancient child of sixteen, a native New Yorker named Holden Caulfield. Through circumstances that tend to preclude adult, secondhand description, he leaves his prep school in Pennsylvania and goes underground in New York City for three days."
reviews: "It is a dark story, very disturbing. I enjoyed it when I was seventeen, so I decided to translate it. I remembered it being funny, but it's dark and strong."

Catherine the Great: Portrait of a Woman.title: Catherine the Great: Portrait of a Woman
Catherine the Great: Portrait of a Woman.author: Robert K. Massie
Catherine the Great: Portrait of a Woman.summary: "The Pulitzer Prize–winning author of Peter the Great, Nicholas and Alexandra, and The Romanovs returns with another masterpiece of narrative biography, the extraordinary story of an obscure German princess who became one of the most remarkable, powerful, and captivating women in history."
reviews: "She was discovering the way to make people like her, and once she had learned the skill, she practiced it brilliantly"

Causality: Models, Reasoning, and Infere.title: Causality: Models, Reasoning, and Inference
Causality: Models, Reasoning, and Infere.author: Judea Pearl
Causality: Models, Reasoning, and Infere.summary: "Written by one of the pre-eminent researchers in the field, this book provides a comprehensive exposition of modern analysis of causation."

A Century of Violence in Soviet Russia\t.title: A Century of Violence in Soviet Russia
A Century of Violence in Soviet Russia\t.author: Alexander N. Yakovlev
A Century of Violence in Soviet Russia\t.summary: "The main architect of the concept of perestroika under Gorbachev, Alexander N. Yakovlev played a unique role in the transformation of the Soviet Union. Now, drawing on his own experiences and on his privileged access to state and Party archives, he reflects on the evils of the system that shaped the country he loves."

Challenging Nature: The Clash Between Bi.title: Challenging Nature: The Clash Between Biotechnology and Spirituality
Challenging Nature: The Clash Between Bi.author: Lee Silver
Challenging Nature: The Clash Between Bi.summary: "In Challenging Nature, Silver argues that although they seem to have little in common, Christian fundamentalists opposed to embryo research and New Age organic food devotees are both driven by a deeply rooted fear that biotechnology—in some guise—challenges the sovereignty of a higher or deeper transcendent authority."

Child of the Jungle: The True Story of a.title: Child of the Jungle: The True Story of a Girl Caught Between Two Worlds
Child of the Jungle: The True Story of a.author: Sabine Kuegler
Child of the Jungle: The True Story of a.summary: "Sabine Kuegler was five years old when her family-- her German linguist-missionary parents and her siblings-- moved to the territory of the recently discovered hunter-and-gatherer Fayu tribe of Papua New Guinea. [...] At the age of 17, Sabine found her life turned upside down when she left for Switzerland to attend boarding school and entered traditional society head-on."
reviews: "This extraordinary book brings us into the minds of hunter-gatherers living in swamp forests and shows us how European society looks to an outsider who thinks like a Fayu"

The CIA and American Democracy\tRhodri J.title: The CIA and American Democracy
The CIA and American Democracy\tRhodri J.author: Rhodri Jeffreys-jones
The CIA and American Democracy\tRhodri J.summary: "This third edition of Rhodri Jeffreys-Jones's engrossing history of the Central Intelligence Agency includes a new prologue that discusses the history of the CIA since the end of the Cold War, focusing in particular on the intelligence dimensions of the terrorist attacks on 9/11"

Civilization and Its Discontents\tSigmun.title: Civilization and Its Discontents
Civilization and Its Discontents\tSigmun.author: Sigmund Freud
Civilization and Its Discontents\tSigmun.summary: "Freud’s seminal volume of twentieth-century cultural thought grounded in psychoanalytic theory, now with a new introduction by Christopher Hitchens. Written in the decade before Freud’s death, Civilization and Its Discontents may be his most famous and most brilliant work."

Civilization: The West and the Rest\tNia.title: Civilization: The West and the Rest
Civilization: The West and the Rest\tNia.author: Niall Ferguson
Civilization: The West and the Rest\tNia.summary: "How did the West overtake its Eastern rivals? And has the zenith of Western power now passed? Acclaimed historian Niall Ferguson argues that beginning in the fifteenth century, the West developed six powerful new concepts, or 'killer applications'—competition, science, the rule of law, modern medicine, consumerism, and the work ethic—that the Rest lacked, allowing it to surge past all other competitors."
reviews: "The Harvard historian’s latest does a brilliant job of going beyond just economics as a deciding factor in the tussle between East and West. Religion, culture, the work ethic, and, of course, historical context all play a role. It’s worth a read to get up to speed on what Ferguson considers Western civilization’s six killer apps.”

"I love big, sweeping history, and this account of the West's rise to global dominance is one of the best recent examples. As always with Ferguson, you can disagree with him and still admire his work for being smart, provocative, and well written."

Clear Light of Day\tAnita Desai.title: Clear Light of Day
Clear Light of Day\tAnita Desai.author: Anita Desai
Clear Light of Day\tAnita Desai.summary: "Set in India's Old Delhi, Clear Light of Day is Anita Desai's tender, warm, and compassionate novel about family scars, the ability to forgive and forget, and the trials and tribulations of familial love."

The Collapse: The Accidental Opening of.title: The Collapse: The Accidental Opening of the Berlin Wall
The Collapse: The Accidental Opening of.author: Mary Elise Sarotte
The Collapse: The Accidental Opening of.summary: "In The Collapse, prize-winning historian Mary Elise Sarotte reveals how a perfect storm of decisions made by daring underground revolutionaries, disgruntled Stasi officers, and dictatorial party bosses sparked an unexpected series of events culminating in the chaotic fall of the Wall. With a novelist’s eye for character and detail, she brings to vivid life a story that sweeps across Budapest, Prague, Dresden, and Leipzig and up to the armed checkpoints in Berlin."

Collected Poems: Auden\tW H Auden.title: Collected Poems: Auden
Collected Poems: Auden\tW H Auden.author: W H Auden
Collected Poems: Auden\tW H Auden.summary: "Between 1927 and his death in 1973, W. H. Auden endowed poetry in the English language with a new face.  Or rather, with several faces, since his work ranged from the political to the religious, from the urbane to the pastoral, from the mandarin to the invigoratingly plain-spoken."

Collected Poems\tPhilip Larkin.title: Collected Poems
Collected Poems\tPhilip Larkin.author: Philip Larkin
Collected Poems\tPhilip Larkin.summary: "One of the best-known and best-loved poets of the English-speaking world, Philip Larkin had only a small number of poems published during his lifetime. Collected Poems brings together not only all his books--The North Ship, The Less Deceived, The Whitsun Weddings, and High Windows--but also his uncollected poems from 1940 to 1984."

Colonial Fantasies: Towards a Feminist R.title: Colonial Fantasies: Towards a Feminist Reading of Orientalism
Colonial Fantasies: Towards a Feminist R.author: Meyda Yegenoglu
Colonial Fantasies: Towards a Feminist R.summary: "Meyda Yegenoglu investigates the intersection between postcolonial and feminist criticism, via the Western fascination with the veiled women of the Orient."
reviews: "Yegenoglu’s critical, post-feminist approach explores the western fascination with the veil and the veiled women of the east."

The Common Reader\tVirginia Woolf.title: The Common Reader
The Common Reader\tVirginia Woolf.author: Virginia Woolf
The Common Reader\tVirginia Woolf.summary: "Woolf’s first and most popular volume of essays. This collection has more than twenty-five selections, including such important statements as Modern Fiction and The Modern Essay."

The Company of Strangers: A Natural Hist.title: The Company of Strangers: A Natural History of Economic Life
The Company of Strangers: A Natural Hist.author: Paul Seabright
The Company of Strangers: A Natural Hist.summary: "Drawing on insights from biology, anthropology, history, psychology, and literature, Paul Seabright explores how our evolved ability of abstract reasoning has allowed institutions like money, markets, cities, and the banking system to provide the foundations of social trust that we need in our everyday lives."
reviews: “An economic history of civilization, with an evolutionary perspective, explaining the emergence of trade, money, firms, law, banks, and all the rest of the economic world, and also explaining the fragility of our economic system if we don’t understand its foundations and dynamics. Lucid and fascinating.”

The Complete Works\tMichel de Montaigne.title: The Complete Works
The Complete Works\tMichel de Montaigne.author: Michel de Montaigne
The Complete Works\tMichel de Montaigne.summary: "Humanist, skeptic, acute observer of himself and others, Michel de Montaigne (1533—92) was the first to use the term 'essay' to refer to the form he pioneered, and he has remained one of its most famous practitioners. He reflected on the great themes of existence in his wise and engaging writings, his subjects ranging from proper conversation and good reading, to the raising of children and the endurance of pain, from solitude, destiny, time, and custom, to truth, consciousness, and death."

The Concept of Mind\tGilbert Ryle.title: The Concept of Mind
The Concept of Mind\tGilbert Ryle.author: Gilbert Ryle
The Concept of Mind\tGilbert Ryle.summary: " Ryle's linguistic analysis remaps the conceptual geography of mind, not so much solving traditional philosophical problems as dissolving them into the mere consequences of misguided language."

Conditions of Love: The Philosophy of In.title: Conditions of Love: The Philosophy of Intimacy
Conditions of Love: The Philosophy of In.author: John Armstrong
Conditions of Love: The Philosophy of In.summary: "‘What is it to love another person?’ This is to raise one of the deepest, and most puzzling, questions we can put to ourselves."

The Confessions\tJean Jacques Rousseau.title: The Confessions
The Confessions\tJean Jacques Rousseau.author: Jean Jacques Rousseau
The Confessions\tJean Jacques Rousseau.summary: "When it was first published, The Confessions scandalised Europe with its emotional honesty and frank treatment of the author's sexual and intellectual development."

The Confidence Trap: A History of Democr.title: The Confidence Trap: A History of Democracy in Crisis from World War I to the Present
The Confidence Trap: A History of Democr.author: David Runciman
The Confidence Trap: A History of Democr.summary: "In The Confidence Trap, David Runciman shows that democracies are good at recovering from emergencies but bad at avoiding them."

The Conquest of Happiness\tBertrand Russ.title: The Conquest of Happiness
The Conquest of Happiness\tBertrand Russ.author: Bertrand Russell
The Conquest of Happiness\tBertrand Russ.summary: "In The Conquest of Happiness, iconoclastic philosopher Bertrand Russell attempted to diagnose the myriad causes of unhappiness in modern life and chart a path out of the seemingly inescapable malaise so prevalent even in safe and prosperous Western societies."

Consciousness Explained\tDaniel Dennett.title: Consciousness Explained
Consciousness Explained\tDaniel Dennett.author: Daniel Dennett
Consciousness Explained\tDaniel Dennett.summary: "Advances a new theory of consciousness based on insights gleaned from the fields of neuroscience, psychology, and artificial intelligence, and clears away obsolete myths about the process of thinking in conscious beings."

Consciousness\tSusan Blackmore.title: Consciousness
Consciousness\tSusan Blackmore.author: Susan Blackmore
Consciousness\tSusan Blackmore.summary: "This ground-breaking textbook by best-selling author Susan Blackmore was the first of its kind to bring together all the major theories of consciousness studies, from those based on neuroscience to those based on quantum theory or Eastern philosophy."
reviews: "I am glad to find a complete book dealing with all aspects of consciousness in CLEARLY written format, with graphs and tables to facilitate comprehension. The book covers everything I had seen before from Artificial Intelligence to Philosophy to Neurology to Evolutionary Biology."

Constantine's Sword: The Church and the.title: Constantine's Sword: The Church and the Jews, A History
Constantine's Sword: The Church and the.author: James Carroll
Constantine's Sword: The Church and the.summary: "In a bold and moving book that is sure to spark heated debate, the novelist and cultural critic James Carroll maps the profoundly troubling two-thousand-year course of the Church’s battle against Judaism and faces the crisis of faith it has provoked in his own life as a Catholic."

Cortex and Mind: Unifying Cognition\tJoa.title: Cortex and Mind: Unifying Cognition
Cortex and Mind: Unifying Cognition\tJoa.author: Joaquin Fuster
Cortex and Mind: Unifying Cognition\tJoa.summary: "This book presents a unique synthesis of the current neuroscience of cognition by one of the world's authorities in the field. The guiding principle to this synthesis is the tenet that the entirety of our knowledge is encoded by relations, and thus by connections, in neuronal networks of our cerebral cortex."

Crazy Is a Compliment: The Power of Zigg.title: Crazy Is a Compliment: The Power of Zigging When Everyone Else Zags
Crazy Is a Compliment: The Power of Zigg.author: Linda Rottenberg
Crazy Is a Compliment: The Power of Zigg.summary: "These days taking chances isn’t just for college dropouts in hoodies. Whether you work at a Fortune 500 company, a nonprofit, or a mom-and-pop, everybody needs to think and act like an entrepreneur. We all need to be nimble, adaptive, daring—and maybe even a little crazy—or risk being left behind."

Creating Innovators: The Making of Young.title: Creating Innovators: The Making of Young People Who Will Change the World
Creating Innovators: The Making of Young.author: Tony Wagner
Creating Innovators: The Making of Young.summary: "From a prominent educator, author, and founder of Harvard’s Change Leadership Group comes a provocative look at why innovation is today’s most essential real-world skill and what young people need from parents, teachers, and employers to become the innovators of America’s future."

Creation: How Science is Reinventing Lif.title: Creation: How Science is Reinventing Life Itself
Creation: How Science is Reinventing Lif.author: Adam Rutherford
Creation: How Science is Reinventing Lif.summary: "As we come closer and closer to understanding the ancient root that connects all living things, Adam Rutherford shows how we may finally be able to achieve the creation of new life where none existed before."

Cuckoo: Cheating by Nature\tNick Davies.title: Cuckoo: Cheating by Nature
Cuckoo: Cheating by Nature\tNick Davies.author: Nick Davies
Cuckoo: Cheating by Nature\tNick Davies.summary: "Like a detective, Davies and his colleagues studied adult cuckoo behavior, cuckoo egg markings, and cuckoo chick begging calls to discover exactly how cuckoos trick their hosts. For birding and evolution aficionados, Cuckoo is a lyrical and scientifically satisfying exploration of one of nature’s most astonishing and beautiful adaptations."
reviews: "Nick Davies’s decades-long study of how cuckoos have evolved their strange parasitic lifestyles mixes hard science with soft nature in a satisfying way."

So Damn Much Money: The Triumph of Lobby.title: So Damn Much Money: The Triumph of Lobbying and the Corrosion of American Government
So Damn Much Money: The Triumph of Lobby.author: Robert Kaiser
So Damn Much Money: The Triumph of Lobby.summary: "In So Damn Much Money, veteran Washington Post editor and correspondent Robert Kaiser gives a detailed account of how the boom in political lobbying since the 1970s has shaped American politics by empowering special interests, undermining effective legislation, and discouraging the country’s best citizens from serving in office."

Dark Universe\tDaniel Galouye.title: Dark Universe
Dark Universe\tDaniel Galouye.author: Daniel Galouye
Dark Universe\tDaniel Galouye.summary: "The Survivors live deep underground in a world of complete darkness, divided into two clans, one living in the Lower Level and one in the Upper Level."
reviews: "The people of this sci-fi novel live underground in darkness. They retain 'light' in their language, but only in allusions to a lost paradise. They worship Light ('For Light's sake!'), and their theology includes demonic figures that engineered the fall from Light's grace. The demons are called Strontium, Cobalt, and the arch-devil, 'Hydrogen Himself.' Go figure, as you Americans say."

Days of Reading\tMarcel Proust.title: Days of Reading
Days of Reading\tMarcel Proust.author: Marcel Proust
Days of Reading\tMarcel Proust.summary: "In these inspiring essays about why people read, Proust explores all the pleasures and trials that readers take from books and the joys of losing oneself in literature."

Deadly Feasts: The \"Prion\" Controversy.title: Deadly Feasts: The "Prion" Controversy and the Public's Health
Deadly Feasts: The \"Prion\" Controversy.author: Richard Rhodes
Deadly Feasts: The \"Prion\" Controversy.summary: "In this brilliant and gripping medical detective story. Richard Rhodes follows virus hunters on three continents as they track the emergence of a deadly new brain disease that first kills cannibals in New Guinea, then cattle and young people in Britain and France—and that has already been traced to food animals in the United States."

The Death of Ivan Illych\tLeo Tolstoy.title: The Death of Ivan Illych
The Death of Ivan Illych\tLeo Tolstoy.author: Leo Tolstoy
The Death of Ivan Illych\tLeo Tolstoy.summary: "The Death of Ivan Ilyich tells the story of the sufferings and death of a high-court judge from a terminal illness in 19th-century Russia."

The Death of the Moth\tVirginia Woolf.title: The Death of the Moth
The Death of the Moth\tVirginia Woolf.author: Virginia Woolf
The Death of the Moth\tVirginia Woolf.summary: "A posthumous collection of her essays, written over a twenty year period, but issued ten years after her Second Common Reader. For the most part, the essays fall into two classes slight, charming, almost idyllic bits of atmosphere writing; and critical essays, chiefly on figures of a period past."

Debt: The First 5,000 Years\tDavid Graeb.title: Debt: The First 5,000 Years
Debt: The First 5,000 Years\tDavid Graeb.author: David Graeber
Debt: The First 5,000 Years\tDavid Graeb.summary: "Here anthropologist David Graeber presents a stunning reversal of conventional wisdom: he shows that before there was money, there was debt."
reviews: "The gripping saga of how debt — an abstract virus — became the default operating system for all human commerce."

"His theory about where did money come from is mind-blowing [...] It turns out there's no evidence of [the traditional theory of where money comes from]. Instead, [Dave] argues that money was invented to keep track of debt, and that debt predates money."

Destructive Emotions: A Scientific Dialo.title: Destructive Emotions: A Scientific Dialogue with the Dalai Lama
Destructive Emotions: A Scientific Dialo.author: Daniel Goleman
Destructive Emotions: A Scientific Dialo.summary: "Imagine sitting with the Dalai Lama in his private meeting room with a small group of world-class scientists and philosophers. The talk is lively and fascinating as these leading minds grapple with age-old questions of compelling contemporary urgency."

DMT: The Spirit Molecule: A Doctor's Rev.title: DMT: The Spirit Molecule: A Doctor's Revolutionary Research into the Biology of Near-Death and Mystical Experiences
DMT: The Spirit Molecule: A Doctor's Rev.author: Rick Strassman
DMT: The Spirit Molecule: A Doctor's Rev.summary: "From 1990 to 1995 Dr. Rick Strassman conducted U.S. Government-approved and funded clinical research at the University of New Mexico in which he injected sixty volunteers with DMT, one of the most powerful psychedelics known. His detailed account of those sessions is an extraordinarily riveting inquiry into the nature of the human mind and the therapeutic potential of psychedelics."

The Doctrine of Deification in the Greek.title: The Doctrine of Deification in the Greek Patristic Tradition
The Doctrine of Deification in the Greek.author: Norman Russell
The Doctrine of Deification in the Greek.summary: "This book, the first on the subject for over sixty years, traces the history of deification from its birth as a second-century metaphor with biblical roots to its maturity as a doctrine central to the spiritual life of the Byzantine Church."
reviews: "I initially bought this book as I was curious about the differences between Eastern & Western traditions, particularly with the notion of theosis –the deification of man. This book goes far deeper, and covers pre-Christian practices (like Stoic thoughts, the deifications of Kings, Roman Emperors, that of private citizens who committed symbolic acts –such as Antinous, Hadrian’s obsession, who drowned to 'save' mankind and other sotirologies)."

The Double Helix: A Personal Account of.title: The Double Helix: A Personal Account of the Discovery of the Structure of DNA
The Double Helix: A Personal Account of.author: James Watson
The Double Helix: A Personal Account of.summary: "By identifying the structure of DNA, the molecule of life, Francis Crick and James Watson revolutionized biochemistry and won themselves a Nobel Prize. At the time, Watson was only twenty-four, a young scientist hungry to make his mark. His uncompromisingly honest account of the heady days of their thrilling sprint against other world-class researchers to solve one of science's greatest mysteries gives a dazzlingly clear picture of a world of brilliant scientists with great gifts, very human ambitions, and bitter rivalries."
reviews: "...gave me the important message — which my teachers had somehow mostly missed telling me — that science is not a catalog of facts, but the search for new and bigger mysteries."

The Effective Executive: The Definitive.title: The Effective Executive: The Definitive Guide to Getting the Right Things Done
The Effective Executive: The Definitive.author: Peter Drucker
The Effective Executive: The Definitive.summary: "Ranging widely through the annals of business and government, Peter F. Drucker demonstrates the distinctive skill of the executive and offers fresh insights into old and seemingly obvious business situations."
reviews: "I devoured this book while in college. I can’t say that I’ve always been an effective executive, but Peter Drucker was a hero of mine."

The Elegant Universe: Superstrings, Hidd.title: The Elegant Universe: Superstrings, Hidden Dimensions, and the Quest for the Ultimate Theory
The Elegant Universe: Superstrings, Hidd.author: Brian Greene
The Elegant Universe: Superstrings, Hidd.summary: "Brian Greene, one of the world's leading string theorists, peels away layers of mystery to reveal a universe that consists of eleven dimensions, where the fabric of space tears and repairs itself, and all matter―from the smallest quarks to the most gargantuan supernovas―is generated by the vibrations of microscopically tiny loops of energy."

Empire: How Britain Made the Modern Worl.title: Empire: How Britain Made the Modern World
Empire: How Britain Made the Modern Worl.author: Niall Ferguson
Empire: How Britain Made the Modern Worl.summary: "Niall Ferguson's acclaimed Empire brilliantly unfolds the imperial story [of Britain] in all its splendours and its miseries, showing how a gang of buccaneers and gold-diggers planted the seed of the biggest empire in all history - and set the world on the road to modernity."

The End of History and the Last Man\tFra.title: The End of History and the Last Man
The End of History and the Last Man\tFra.author: Francis Fukuyama
The End of History and the Last Man\tFra.summary: "Francis Fukuyama's prescient analysis of religious fundamentalism, politics, scientific progress, ethical codes, and war is as essential for a world fighting fundamentalist terrorists as it was for the end of the Cold War."
reviews: "This book grew out of a celebrated 1989 essay, published as the Cold War was ending. Fukuyama's ideas are often caricatured, mischaracterized, and misunderstood, but his basic point here still holds. We have witnessed the end of a great centuries-old ideological debate over the right way to organize societies, especially economies"

The End of the World: The Science and Et.title: The End of the World: The Science and Ethics of Human Extinction
The End of the World: The Science and Et.author: John Leslie
The End of the World: The Science and Et.summary: "The End of the World is a sobering assessment of the many disasters that scientists have predicted and speculated on as leading to apocalypse."

Enduring Love\tIan McEwan.title: Enduring Love
Enduring Love\tIan McEwan.author: Ian McEwan
Enduring Love\tIan McEwan.summary: "On a windy spring day in the Chilterns, the calm, organized life of science writer Joe Rose is shattered when he witnesses a tragic accident: a hot-air balloon with a boy trapped in its basket is being tossed by the wind, and in the attempt to save the child, a man is killed."
reviews: "[What books are you currently reading (or have you just finished reading) for your work or for pleasure?]"

An Enquiry Concerning Human Understandin.title: An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding
An Enquiry Concerning Human Understandin.author: David Hume
An Enquiry Concerning Human Understandin.summary: "In this classic work of early modern epistemology, Hume offers important insights about how we come to understand and have knowledge of our world and, in so doing, alter our relationship with it."
reviews: "Then I read Hume’s Enquiry, this wonderful, humane book saying that nobody has all the answers. What we know is what we have evidence for. We do the best we can, but anybody who claims to be able to deduce or have revelation about The Truth – with both Ts capitalised – is wrong. It doesn’t work that way. The only reasonable way to approach life is with an attitude of humane scepticism. I felt that a great weight had been lifted from my shoulders when I read that book."

Essays in Economics: Volume 1: Macroecon.title: Essays in Economics: Volume 1: Macroeconomics
Essays in Economics: Volume 1: Macroecon.author: James Tobin
Essays in Economics: Volume 1: Macroecon.summary: "These 28 essays, covering Tobin's work in macroeconomics from the early 1940s to 1970 are grouped into three parts - macroeconomic theory, economic growth, and money and finance."
reviews: "I took introductory economics with Jim Tobin. He was a great economist and I learned an enormous amount from him, though he isn't very fashionable these days."

Essays in Persuasion\tJM Keynes.title: Essays in Persuasion
Essays in Persuasion\tJM Keynes.author: JM Keynes
Essays in Persuasion\tJM Keynes.summary: "John Keynes [gives] a powerful discussion about the core economic subjects such government role, monetary policy, saving & spending, inflation and deflation, gold standard, and political economy."
reviews: "This business about us becoming so rich that people would stop caring about consuming even more, that turns out not to be true. About enough time has passed for that blissful state to have arrived according to him, and somehow greed always finds a way."

Ethics: Inventing Right and Wrong\tJL Ma.title: Ethics: Inventing Right and Wrong
Ethics: Inventing Right and Wrong\tJL Ma.author: JL Mackie
Ethics: Inventing Right and Wrong\tJL Ma.summary: "This title presents an insight into moral skepticism of the 20th century. The author argues that our every-day moral codes are an 'error theory' based on the presumption of moral facts which, he persuasively argues, don't exist."

Ethics and the Limits of Philosophy \tBe.title: Ethics and the Limits of Philosophy
Ethics and the Limits of Philosophy \tBe.author: Bernard Williams
Ethics and the Limits of Philosophy \tBe.summary: "Drawing on the ideas of the Greek philosophers, Williams reorients ethics away from a preoccupation with universal moral theories towards ‘truth, truthfulness and the meaning of an individual life’. "

On the Eve of the Millenium: The Future.title: On the Eve of the Millenium: The Future of Democracy Through an Age of Unreason
On the Eve of the Millenium: The Future.author: Conor Cruise O'Brien
On the Eve of the Millenium: The Future.summary: "In these wide-ranging and penetrating essays, O'Brien examines how throughout the world today these age-old forces [of nationalism and religion] are once again threatening democracy, the rule of law, and freedom of expression -- particularly in the United States, the nation founded on Enlightenment values."

Explaining Social Behavior: More Nuts an.title: Explaining Social Behavior: More Nuts and Bolts for the Social Sciences
Explaining Social Behavior: More Nuts an.author: Jon Elster
Explaining Social Behavior: More Nuts an.summary: "In twenty-six succinct chapters, Jon Elster provides an account of the nature of explanation in the social sciences."
reviews: "I read this book twice. The first time, I thought that it was excellent, the best compendium of ideas of social science by arguably the best thinker in the field. I took copious notes, etc. I agreed with its patchwork-style approach to rational decision making. I knew that it had huge insights applicable to my refusal of general theories [they don’t work], rather limit ourselves to nuts and bolts [they work]."

The Fabric of Reality: The Science of Pa.title: The Fabric of Reality: The Science of Parallel Universes and Its Implications
The Fabric of Reality: The Science of Pa.author: David Deutsch
The Fabric of Reality: The Science of Pa.summary: "For David Deutsch, a young physicist of unusual originality, quantum theory contains our most fundamental knowledge of the physical world. Taken literally, it implies that there are many universes 'parallel' to the one we see around us. This multiplicity of universes, according to Deutsch, turns out to be the key to achieving a new worldview, one which synthesizes the theories of evolution, computation, and knowledge with quantum physics."

The Fall: The Insanity of the Ego in Hum.title: The Fall: The Insanity of the Ego in Human History and the Dawning of A New Era
The Fall: The Insanity of the Ego in Hum.author: Steve Taylor
The Fall: The Insanity of the Ego in Hum.summary: "[Taylor] challenges us all to transcend the ego and integrate the intellectual brilliance it has given us with the intense connectedness and aliveness that spiritual practices can bring us."
reviews: "An important and fascinating book about the origin, history and impending demise of the ego - humanity's collective dysfunction. The Fall is highly readable and enlightening, as the author's acute mind is at all times imbued with the higher faculty of spiritual awareness."

The Feeling of What Happens: Body and Em.title: The Feeling of What Happens: Body and Emotion in the Making of Consciousness
The Feeling of What Happens: Body and Em.author: Antonio Damasio
The Feeling of What Happens: Body and Em.summary: "A renowned and revered scientist and clinician, Damasio has spent decades following amnesiacs down hospital corridors, waiting for comatose patients to awaken, and devising ingenious research using PET scans to piece together the great puzzle of consciousness."

Ficciones\tJorge Luis Borges.title: Ficciones
Ficciones\tJorge Luis Borges.author: Jorge Luis Borges
Ficciones\tJorge Luis Borges.summary: "The seventeen pieces in Ficciones demonstrate the whirlwind of Borges’s genius and mirror the precision and potency of his intellect and inventiveness, his piercing irony, his skepticism, and his obsession with fantasy."
reviews: "I read one of Borges’ short stories in a science-fiction magazine when I was 20, and I immediately fell in love with his style and his universe. Later on, I discovered that the short story, 'The Babel Library,' was part of this collection of short stories. Borges is the only South American writer all of whose books I have read and reread."

Fighting the Ideological War: Winning St.title: Fighting the Ideological War: Winning Strategies from Communism to Islamism
Fighting the Ideological War: Winning St.author: Patrick Sookhdeo
Fighting the Ideological War: Winning St.summary: "This collection of essays proposes an effective strategy for countering and defeating the beliefs that motivate Islamists. It examines those beliefs in detail, considers their strengths and weaknesses, and draws on the lessons of past ideological conflicts. Thus it provides invaluable equipment for the war of ideas in which we must now engage."
reviews: "[If you could require the president to read one book, what would it be?] I suggest Fighting the Ideological War"

The Filter Bubble: How the New Personali.title: The Filter Bubble: How the New Personalized Web Is Changing What We Read and How We Think
The Filter Bubble: How the New Personali.author: Eli Pariser
The Filter Bubble: How the New Personali.summary: "The Filter Bubble tells the story of how the Internet, a medium built around the open flow of ideas, is closing in on itself under the pressure of commerce and 'monetization.'"

The Fire Next Time\tJames Baldwin.title: The Fire Next Time
The Fire Next Time\tJames Baldwin.author: James Baldwin
The Fire Next Time\tJames Baldwin.summary: "The Fire Next Time galvanized the nation and gave passionate voice to the emerging civil rights movement. At once a powerful evocation of James Baldwin's early life in Harlem and a disturbing examination of the consequences of racial injustice, the book is an intensely personal and provocative document."
reviews: "[A book you hope parents read to their children] His letter to his nephew is wise advice to love and serve.

The First Crusade: A New History: The Ro.title: The First Crusade: A New History: The Roots of Conflict between Christianity and Islam
The First Crusade: A New History: The Ro.author: Thomas Asbridge
The First Crusade: A New History: The Ro.summary: "In The First Crusade, Thomas Asbridge offers a gripping account of a titanic three-year adventure filled with miraculous victories, greedy princes, and barbarity on a vast scale."

First Person: An Astonishingly Frank Sel.title: First Person: An Astonishingly Frank Self-Portrait by Russia's President
First Person: An Astonishingly Frank Sel.author: Vladimir Putin
First Person: An Astonishingly Frank Sel.summary: "First Person is an intimate, candid portrait of the man who holds the future of Russia in his grip. An extraordinary compilation of over 24 hours of in-depth interviews and remarkable photographs, it delves deep into Putin's KGB past and explores his meteoric rise to power."

Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experien.title: Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience
Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experien.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi
Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experien.summary: "Psychologist Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi's famous investigations of 'optimal experience' have revealed that what makes an experience genuinely satisfying is a state of consciousness called flow."

The Forever War\tDexter Filkins.title: The Forever War
The Forever War\tDexter Filkins.author: Dexter Filkins
The Forever War\tDexter Filkins.summary: "An instant classic of war reporting, The Forever War is the definitive account of America's conflict with Islamic fundamentalism and a searing exploration of its human costs."

The Foundation\tIsaac Asimov.title: The Foundation
The Foundation\tIsaac Asimov.author: Isaac Asimov
The Foundation\tIsaac Asimov.summary: "For twelve thousand years the Galactic Empire has ruled supreme. Now it is dying. But only Hari Sheldon, creator of the revolutionary science of psychohistory, can see into the future--to a dark age of ignorance, barbarism, and warfare that will last thirty thousand years."
reviews: "The lessons of history would suggest that civilizations move in cycles."

"This is a very unusual set of novels from Isaac Asimov, but a classic. It’s not about gadgets. Although it’s supposed to be about a galactic civilisation, the technology is virtually invisible and it’s not about space battles or anything like that. The story is about these people, psychohistorians, who are mathematical social scientists and have a theory about how society works."

Fragments of Culture: The Everyday of Mo.title: Fragments of Culture: The Everyday of Modern Turkey
Fragments of Culture: The Everyday of Mo.author: Deniz Kandiyoti
Fragments of Culture: The Everyday of Mo.summary: "Fragments of Culture explores the evolving modern daily life of Turkey. Through analyses of language, folklore, film, satirical humor, the symbolism of Islamic political mobilization, and the shifting identities of diasporic communities in Turkey and Europe, this book provides a fresh and corrective perspective to the often-skewed perceptions of Turkish culture engendered by conventional western critiques."
reviews: "This is one of my favourite books and an excellent gateway to Turkey’s social, cultural, and political complexity. It is composed of numerous articles by leading scholars in different fields and is therefore, quite multi-disciplinary. "

Freedom from the Known\tJiddu Krishnamur.title: Freedom from the Known
Freedom from the Known\tJiddu Krishnamur.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
Freedom from the Known\tJiddu Krishnamur.summary: "Krishnamurti shows how people can free themselves radically and immediately from the tyranny of the expected, no matter what their age-opening the door to transforming society and their relationships."

Freedom and Neurobiology: Reflections on.title: Freedom and Neurobiology: Reflections on Free Will, Language, and Political Power
Freedom and Neurobiology: Reflections on.author: John Searle
Freedom and Neurobiology: Reflections on.summary: "In Freedom and Neurobiology, the philosopher John Searle discusses the possibility of free will within the context of contemporary neurobiology. He begins by explaining the relationship between human reality and the more fundamental reality as described by physics and chemistry."

Gabriela, Clove and Cinnamon\tJorge Amad.title: Gabriela, Clove and Cinnamon
Gabriela, Clove and Cinnamon\tJorge Amad.author: Jorge Amado
Gabriela, Clove and Cinnamon\tJorge Amad.summary: "Lusty, satirical and full of intrigue, Gabriela, Clove and Cinnamon is a vastly entertaining panorama of small town Brazilian life."
reviews: "Amado is the best Brazilian writer. He portrayed the Brazilian spirit to the world."

The Lymond Chronicles\tDorothy Dunnett.title: The Lymond Chronicles
The Lymond Chronicles\tDorothy Dunnett.author: Dorothy Dunnett
The Lymond Chronicles\tDorothy Dunnett.summary: "The first book in the legendary Lymond Chronicles, Game of Kings takes place in 1547. Scotland has been humiliated by an English invasion and is threatened by machinations elsewhere beyond its borders, but it is still free."
reviews: "I discovered this series of six difficult, complex historical novels about a character roving the world at the turn of the seventeenth century as my company was passing the critical 50-person inflection point. Lymond is a brilliant leader who isn't afraid of the opprobrium of his peers--he does the right thing, seeing further than those around him. He was a hero I aspired to emulate. "

The Gamification Revolution: How Leaders.title: The Gamification Revolution: How Leaders Leverage Game Mechanics to Crush the Competition
The Gamification Revolution: How Leaders.author: Gabe Zichermann
The Gamification Revolution: How Leaders.summary: "Gamification uses the latest innovations from game design, loyalty programs, and behavioral economics to help you cut through the noise and transform your organization into a lean, mean machine ready to fight the battle for user attention and loyalty."

The Genealogy of Morals\tFriedrich Nietz.title: The Genealogy of Morals
The Genealogy of Morals\tFriedrich Nietz.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
The Genealogy of Morals\tFriedrich Nietz.summary: "On the Genealogy of Morals (1887) is a book about interpretation and the history of ethics which raises profoundly disquieting issues about the violence of both."
reviews: "It’s his key work, explaining his theory of how morality and particularly religion emerges from the efforts of the weak to hog-tie the strong (the natural rulers). The strong don’t need brains or cumulative intelligence; the weak do and achieve power by outsmarting the strong. An example is in Leviticus, where the best cuts of meat are reserved for the priests. Nietzsche is great."

The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo\tStiegg.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo\tStiegg.author: Stiegg Larsson
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo\tStiegg.summary: "Murder mystery, family saga, love story, and financial intrigue combine into one satisfyingly complex and entertainingly atmospheric novel."

Global Capitalism: Its Fall and Rise in.title: Global Capitalism: Its Fall and Rise in the Twentieth Century
Global Capitalism: Its Fall and Rise in.author: Jeffrey Frieden
Global Capitalism: Its Fall and Rise in.summary: "Jeffry A. Frieden's insightful history explores the golden age of globalization during the early years of the century, its swift collapse in the crises of 1914-45, the divisions of the Cold War world, and the turn again toward global integration at the end of the century."
reviews: "What’s very useful about it is that it underscores that economic globalisation is not inevitable: Frieden spends a lot of time looking at the collapse of globalisation in the interwar period in the 20th century. The book is also very good at underscoring the domestic political prerequisites of globalisation."

God Is Not Great: How Religion Poisons E.title: God Is Not Great: How Religion Poisons Everything
God Is Not Great: How Religion Poisons E.author: Christopher Hitchens
God Is Not Great: How Religion Poisons E.summary: "In the tradition of Bertrand Russell's Why I Am Not a Christian and Sam Harris's recent bestseller, The End of Faith, Christopher Hitchens makes the ultimate case against religion. With a close and erudite reading of the major religious texts, he documents the ways in which religion is a man-made wish, a cause of dangerous sexual repression, and a distortion of our origins in the cosmos."

The Great Gatsby\tF. Scott Fitzgerald.title: The Great Gatsby
The Great Gatsby\tF. Scott Fitzgerald.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
The Great Gatsby\tF. Scott Fitzgerald.summary: "The story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, of lavish parties on Long Island at a time when The New York Times noted 'gin was the national drink and sex the national obsession,' it is an exquisitely crafted tale of America in the 1920s."
reviews: "Each time I read The Great Gatsby, I feel my heart break. No one else has captured as crisply as Fitzgerald the American dream, the glory of its pursuit and the inevitable sense of betrayal and despair once it is realized — once it is, as Nick puts it, touched by the 'foul dust' of reality."

"Had it not been for Fitzgerald's novel, I would not be writing the kind of literature I am today (indeed, it is possible that I would not be writing at all, although that is neither here not there)."

The Great Transformation: The Political.title: The Great Transformation: The Political and Economic Origins of Our Time
The Great Transformation: The Political.author: Karl Polanyi
The Great Transformation: The Political.summary: "In this classic work of economic history and social theory, Karl Polanyi analyzes the economic and social changes brought about by the 'great transformation' of the Industrial Revolution. His analysis explains not only the deficiencies of the self-regulating market, but the potentially dire social consequences of untempered market capitalism."
reviews: "The Great Transformation is the sort of book that you will only get after reading it three times. Well, that’s what happened to me. It’s one of these books that have the greatest reputation, but are in some sense hardest to read. But it’s worth reading. It’s really a history of the spread of markets, the spread of the gold standard."

The Great War and Modern Memory\tPaul Fu.title: The Great War and Modern Memory
The Great War and Modern Memory\tPaul Fu.author: Paul Fussell
The Great War and Modern Memory\tPaul Fu.summary: "Fussell's landmark study of W.W.I remains as original and gripping today as ever before: a literate, literary, and illuminating account of the Great War, the one that changed a generation, ushered in the modern era, and revolutionized how we see the world."
reviews: "If the war shattered the last vestiges of the old order, peace heralded the birth of modern times. This is the seminal book for understanding what the war implied for a 'lost generation,' and for the world to come."

Guns, Germs, and Steel: The Fates of Hum.title: Guns, Germs, and Steel: The Fates of Human Societies
Guns, Germs, and Steel: The Fates of Hum.author: Jared Diamond
Guns, Germs, and Steel: The Fates of Hum.summary: "Jared Diamond convincingly argues that geographical and environmental factors shaped the modern world. Societies that had had a head start in food production advanced beyond the hunter-gatherer stage, and then developed religion --as well as nasty germs and potent weapons of war --and adventured on sea and land to conquer and decimate preliterate cultures."

The Hand of God: Thoughts and Images Ref.title: The Hand of God: Thoughts and Images Reflecting the Spirit of the Universe
The Hand of God: Thoughts and Images Ref.author: Michael Reagan
The Hand of God: Thoughts and Images Ref.summary: "The Hand of God combines inspiration for the mind and spirit by juxtaposing what Astronomy magazine has called 'the most beautiful astrophotos ever taken' with illuminating words of scientists, poets, and theologians."

Cosby: His Life and Times\tMark Whitaker.title: Cosby: His Life and Times
Cosby: His Life and Times\tMark Whitaker.author: Mark Whitaker
Cosby: His Life and Times\tMark Whitaker.summary: "The first major biography of an American icon, comedian Bill Cosby. Based on extensive research and in-depth interviews with Cosby and more than sixty of his closest friends and associates."

Happy Accidents: Serendipity in Modern M.title: Happy Accidents: Serendipity in Modern Medical Breakthroughs
Happy Accidents: Serendipity in Modern M.author: Morton Meyers
Happy Accidents: Serendipity in Modern M.summary: "This is Morton Meyers' fascinating, entertaining, and highly accessible look at the surprising role serendipity played in some of the most important medical discoveries in the 20th century."
reviews: "It is a MUST read. Please go buy it. Read it twice, not once. Although the author does not take my drastic stochastic tinkering approach, he provides all kind of empirical evidence for the role of design. He does not directly discuss the narrative fallacy(q.v.) and the retrospective distortion (q.v.) but he certainly allows us to rewrite the history of medicine."

On Having No Head: Zen and the Rediscove.title: On Having No Head: Zen and the Rediscovery of the Obvious
On Having No Head: Zen and the Rediscove.author: Douglas E. Harding
On Having No Head: Zen and the Rediscove.summary: "Headlessness, the experience of "no-self" that mystics of all times have aspired to, is an instantaneous way of 'waking up' and becoming fully aware of one's real and abiding nature. Douglas Harding, the highly respected mystic-philosopher, describes his first experience of headlessness in On Having No Head, the classic work first published in 1961."

Heavy Weather\tPG Wodehouse.title: Heavy Weather
Heavy Weather\tPG Wodehouse.author: PG Wodehouse
Heavy Weather\tPG Wodehouse.summary: "Fans of P. G. Wodehouse's comic genius are legion, and their devotion to his masterful command of the hilarity borders on an obsession. It's Heavy Weather for Lord Emsworth and the Empress, especially with the appalling Sir Gregory Parsloe-Parsloe snooping around with designs on the prize pig."
reviews: "One of the great masterpieces, among the many others he’s written."

Hiding in the Mirror: The Quest for Alte.title: Hiding in the Mirror: The Quest for Alternate Realities, from Plato to String Theory
Hiding in the Mirror: The Quest for Alte.author: Lawrence Krauss
Hiding in the Mirror: The Quest for Alte.summary: "Lawrence Krauss -an international leader in physics and cosmology-examines our long and ardent romance with parallel universes, veiled dimensions, and regions of being that may extend tantalizingly beyond the limits of our perception."

Higher Education in the Digital Age\tWil.title: Higher Education in the Digital Age
Higher Education in the Digital Age\tWil.author: William Bowen
Higher Education in the Digital Age\tWil.summary: "Two of the most visible and important trends in higher education today are its exploding costs and the rapid expansion of online learning. Could the growth in online courses slow the rising cost of college and help solve the crisis of affordability?"

The Histories\tHerodotus.title: The Histories
The Histories\tHerodotus.author: Herodotus
The Histories\tHerodotus.summary: "The Histories of Herodotus is now considered the founding work of history in Western literature. Written in 440 BC in the Ionic dialect of classical Greek."

A History of Western Philosophy\tBertran.title: A History of Western Philosophy
A History of Western Philosophy\tBertran.author: Bertrand Russell
A History of Western Philosophy\tBertran.summary: "Considered to be one of the most important philosophical works of all time, the History of Western Philosophy is a dazzlingly unique exploration of the ideologies of significant philosophers throughout the ages—from Plato and Aristotle through to Spinoza, Kant and the twentieth century."

The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy\tDo.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy\tDo.author: Douglas Adams
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy\tDo.summary: "Seconds before the Earth is demolished to make way for a galactic freeway, Arthur Dent is plucked off the planet by his friend Ford Prefect, a researcher for the revised edition of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy who, for the last fifteen years, has been posing as an out-of-work actor."
reviews: "If you can properly phrase the question, then the answer is the easy part. So, to the degree that we can better understand the universe, then we can better know what questions to ask."

The Hobbit\tJRR Tolkien.title: The Hobbit
The Hobbit\tJRR Tolkien.author: JRR Tolkien
The Hobbit\tJRR Tolkien.summary: "J.R.R. Tolkien's own description for the original edition: 'If you care for journeys there and back, out of the comfortable Western world, over the edge of the Wild, and home again, and can take an interest in a humble hero (blessed with a little wisdom and a little courage and considerable good luck), here is a record of such a journey and such a traveler.'"
reviews: "As compelling as ever"

Holy Madness: The Shock Tactics and Radi.title: Holy Madness: The Shock Tactics and Radical Teachings of Crazy-Wise Adepts, Holy Fools and Rascal Gurus
Holy Madness: The Shock Tactics and Radi.author: Georg Feuerstein
Holy Madness: The Shock Tactics and Radi.summary: "This book explores this universal dimension of spirituality in a blend of history, philosophy, theology and first-person accounts."

Home Is Where We Start From: Essays by a.title: Home Is Where We Start From: Essays by a Psychoanalyst
Home Is Where We Start From: Essays by a.author: D.W. Winnicott
Home Is Where We Start From: Essays by a.summary: "One of the most gifted and creative psychoanalysts of his generation, D. W. Winnicott made lasting contributions to our understanding of the minds of children. This collection brings together many of Winnicott's most important pieces, including previously unpublished talks and several essays from books and journals now difficult to obtain."

How to Worry Less About Money\tJohn Arms.title: How to Worry Less About Money
How to Worry Less About Money\tJohn Arms.author: John Armstrong
How to Worry Less About Money\tJohn Arms.summary: "Offering surprising and helpful new insights, this book will encourage you to redefine your feelings about money, and ultimately enable you to discover what is really important to you in life."

Howard Hughes: His Life and Madness\tDon.title: Howard Hughes: His Life and Madness
Howard Hughes: His Life and Madness\tDon.author: Donald Barlett
Howard Hughes: His Life and Madness\tDon.summary: "Howard Hughes has always fascinated the public with his mixture of secrecy, dashing lifestyle, and reclusiveness. This is the book that breaks through the image to get at the man."
reviews: "Definitely want to make sure I don't grow my fingernails too long and start peeing in jars."

Human, All-Too-Human: A Book for Free Sp.title: Human, All-Too-Human: A Book for Free Spirits
Human, All-Too-Human: A Book for Free Sp.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Human, All-Too-Human: A Book for Free Sp.summary: "A complex work that explores many themes to which Nietzsche later returned, it marks a significant departure from his previous thinking. Here Nietzsche breaks with his early allegiance to Schopenhauer and Wagner, and establishes the overall framework of his later philosophy."

Human: The Science Behind What Makes You.title: Human: The Science Behind What Makes Your Brain Unique
Human: The Science Behind What Makes You.author: Michael Gazzaniga
Human: The Science Behind What Makes You.summary: "What happened along the evolutionary trail that made humans so unique? In his accessible style, Michael Gazzaniga pinpoints the change that made us thinking, sentient humans different from our predecessors."

Hyperspace\tMichio Kaku.title: Hyperspace
Hyperspace\tMichio Kaku.author: Michio Kaku
Hyperspace\tMichio Kaku.summary: "The first book-length exploration of the most exciting development in modern physics, the theory of 10-dimensional space. The theory of hyperspace, which Michio Kaku pioneered, may be the leading candidate for the Theory of Everything that Einstein spent the remaining years of his life searching for."

I Am That\tNisargadatta Maharaj.title: I Am That
I Am That\tNisargadatta Maharaj.author: Nisargadatta Maharaj
I Am That\tNisargadatta Maharaj.summary: "This collection of the timeless teachings of one of the greatest sages of India, Sri Nisargadatta Maharaj, is a testament to the uniqueness of the seer's life and work and is regarded by many as a modern spiritual classic."

If You Want to Write: A Book about Art,.title: If You Want to Write: A Book about Art, Independence and Spirit
If You Want to Write: A Book about Art,.author: Brenda Ueland
If You Want to Write: A Book about Art,.summary: "For most, the hardest part of writing is overcoming the mountain of self-denial that weighs upon the spirit, always threatening to extinguish those first small embers of ambition. Brenda Ueland, a writer and teacher, devotes most of her book--published back in 1938, before everyone and their goldfish got their MFA's in creative writing--to these matters of the writer's heart."
reviews: "Perhaps my favorite book of all time. It was my guiding light when I first started writing. Obviously, the book is for writers, but if you substitute 'program,' 'market,' 'evangelize,' or 'start' for the word 'write,' you’ll see why its concepts are widely applicable.

The Illusion of Conscious Will \tDaniel.title: The Illusion of Conscious Will
The Illusion of Conscious Will \tDaniel.author: Daniel Wegner
The Illusion of Conscious Will \tDaniel.summary: "Do we consciously cause our actions, or do they happen to us? Philosophers, psychologists, neuroscientists, theologians, and lawyers have long debated the existence of free will versus determinism. In this book Daniel Wegner offers a novel understanding of the issue."

Information: The New Language of Science.title: Information: The New Language of Science
Information: The New Language of Science.author: Hans Christian von Baeyer
Information: The New Language of Science.summary: "In this indispensable volume, a primer for the information age, Hans Christian von Baeyer presents a clear description of what information is, how concepts of its measurement, meaning, and transmission evolved, and what its ever-expanding presence portends for the future."
reviews: "If you want an introduction to information theory, and, in a way, probability theory from the real front door, this is it. A clearly written book, very intuitive, explains things, such as the Monty Hall problem in a few lines."

The Information: A History, A Theory, A.title: The Information: A History, A Theory, A Flood
The Information: A History, A Theory, A.author: James Gleick
The Information: A History, A Theory, A.summary: "Acclaimed science writer James Gleick presents an eye-opening vision of how our relationship to information has transformed the very nature of human consciousness."
