The Innovators: How a Group of Hackers,.title: The Innovators: How a Group of Hackers, Geniuses, and Geeks Created the Digital Revolution
The Innovators: How a Group of Hackers,.author: Walter Isaacson
The Innovators: How a Group of Hackers,.summary: "Following his blockbuster biography of Steve Jobs, The Innovators is Walter Isaacson’s revealing story of the people who created the computer and the Internet. It is destined to be the standard history of the digital revolution and an indispensable guide to how innovation really happens."

Inquiries into Truth and Interpretation\.title: Inquiries into Truth and Interpretation
Inquiries into Truth and Interpretation\.author: Donald Davidson
Inquiries into Truth and Interpretation\.summary: "Now in a new edition, this volume updates Davidson's exceptional Inquiries into Truth and Interpretation (1984), which set out his enormously influential philosophy of language."

Inquisition\tEdward Peters.title: Inquisition
Inquisition\tEdward Peters.author: Edward Peters
Inquisition\tEdward Peters.summary: "This impressive volume is actually three histories in one: of the legal procedures, personnel, and institutions that shaped the inquisitorial tribunals from Rome to early modern Europe; of the myth of The Inquisition, from its origins with the anti-Hispanists and religious reformers of the sixteenth century to its embodiment in literary and artistic masterpieces of the nineteenth century; and of how the myth itself became the foundation for a 'history' of the inquisitions."

Interaction Ritual - Essays on Face-to-F.title: Interaction Ritual - Essays on Face-to-Face Behavior
Interaction Ritual - Essays on Face-to-F.author: Erving Goffman
Interaction Ritual - Essays on Face-to-F.summary: "In a brilliant series of books about social behavior, including The Presentation of Self in Everyday Life, Asylums, and Stigma, Erving Goffman has exposed all that is at stake when people meet face to face. Goffman’s work, once of the great intellectual achievements of our time, is an endlessly fascinating commentary on how we enact ourselves by our responses to and our readings of other people."

Into the Silence: The Great War, Mallory.title: Into the Silence: The Great War, Mallory, and the Conquest of Everest
Into the Silence: The Great War, Mallory.author: Wade Davis
Into the Silence: The Great War, Mallory.summary: "The definitive story of the British adventurers who survived the trenches of World War I and went on to risk their lives climbing Mount Everest."
reviews: "The account of the 1920s Everest expeditions, ending in Mallory and Irvine’s disappearance high on the mountain in 1924, is interwoven with the World War I back stories of each participant, in a truly original way."

Into That Darkness: An Examination of Co.title: Into That Darkness: An Examination of Conscience
Into That Darkness: An Examination of Co.author: Gitta Sereny
Into That Darkness: An Examination of Co.summary: "Based on 70 hours of interviews with Franz Stangl, commandant of Treblinka (the largest of the extermination camps), this book bares the soul of a man who continually found ways to rationalize his role in Hitler's final soulution."

Invariances: The Structure of the Object.title: Invariances: The Structure of the Objective World
Invariances: The Structure of the Object.author: Robert Nozick
Invariances: The Structure of the Object.summary: "Recent scientific advances have placed many traditional philosophical concepts under great stress. In this pathbreaking book, the eminent philosopher Robert Nozick rethinks and transforms the concepts of truth, objectivity, necessity, contingency, consciousness, and ethics."
reviews: "Aside from the purely philosophical answers that scientists were grappling with, the book is like a manual for a new regimen in philosophy. It reviews everything from epistemology to the logic of contingency, with insights here and there about such topics as the observer biases (about computing probabilities when our existence has been linked to a particular realization of the process)."

The Invisibles: You Say You Want a Revol.title: The Invisibles: You Say You Want a Revolution
The Invisibles: You Say You Want a Revol.author: Grant Morrison
The Invisibles: You Say You Want a Revol.summary: "Throughout history, a secret society called the Invisibles works against the forces that seek to hold back humanity's growth. Their latest recruit, a teenaged lout, must survive a bizarre, mind altering training course before being whicksed back in time to wit."
reviews: "Grant understands magic, for real, and uses this engaging comic book series to teach his more clever readers how to direct their energy towards whatever ends they choose. This comic changed the way millions of young people think about the rules."

Irreligion: A Mathematician Explains Why.title: Irreligion: A Mathematician Explains Why the Arguments for God Just Don't Add Up
Irreligion: A Mathematician Explains Why.author: John Allen Paulos
Irreligion: A Mathematician Explains Why.summary: "Are there any logical reasons to believe in God? The mathematician and bestselling author John Allen Paulos thinks not."

Istanbul: The Imperial City\tJohn Freely.title: Istanbul: The Imperial City
Istanbul: The Imperial City\tJohn Freely.author: John Freely
Istanbul: The Imperial City\tJohn Freely.summary: "Istanbul's history is a catalogue of change, not least of name, yet it has managed to retain its own unique identity. John Freely captures the flavour of daily life as well as court ceremonial and intrigue."
reviews: "One of the things that I most like about this book is the way it pays attention to daily life, popular legends, and ordinary people, not only to palace intricacies, court etiquette or historical monuments."

The Journalist and the Murderer\tJanet M.title: The Journalist and the Murderer
The Journalist and the Murderer\tJanet M.author: Janet Malcolm
The Journalist and the Murderer\tJanet M.summary: "In two previous books, Janet Malcolm explored the hidden sides of, respectively, institutional psychoanalysis and Freudian biography. In this book, she examines the psychopathology of journalism."

Just My Type: A Book About Fonts\tSimon.title: Just My Type: A Book About Fonts
Just My Type: A Book About Fonts\tSimon.author: Simon Garfield
Just My Type: A Book About Fonts\tSimon.summary: "A delightfully inquisitive tour that explores the rich history and the subtle powers of fonts. Fonts surround us every day, on street signs and buildings, on movie posters and books, and on just about every product that we buy. But where do fonts come from and why do we need so many?"

King Lear\tWilliam Shakespeare.title: King Lear
King Lear\tWilliam Shakespeare.author: William Shakespeare
King Lear\tWilliam Shakespeare.summary: "First performed about 1805, King Lear is one of the most relentlessly bleak of Shakespeare's tragedies. Probably written between Othello and Macbeth, when the playwright was at the peak of his tragic power, Lear's themes of filial ingratitude, injustice, and the meaninglessness of life in a seemingly indifferent universe are explored with unsurpassed power and depth."

Krishnamurti's Notebook\tJiddu Krishnamu.title: Krishnamurti's Notebook
Krishnamurti's Notebook\tJiddu Krishnamu.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
Krishnamurti's Notebook\tJiddu Krishnamu.summary: "When Krishnamurti's Notebook first became available in 1976, it was soon realized that it was a spiritually unique document giving his perceptions and experiences and describing his states of consciousness."

The Saga of Khassak\tOV Vijayan.title: The Saga of Khassak
The Saga of Khassak\tOV Vijayan.author: OV Vijayan
The Saga of Khassak\tOV Vijayan.summary: "The Legends Of Khasak is a literary masterpiece about a young man named Ravi, who wanders into a remote village called Khasak in Kerala. This novel covers the boy s experiences in the new place, and also brings to light his existential crisis."
reviews: "This was originally a Malayalam novel that invented magic realism 20 years before Gabriel García Márquez attempted it."

Life at the Bottom: The Worldview That M.title: Life at the Bottom: The Worldview That Makes the Underclass
Life at the Bottom: The Worldview That M.author: Theodore Dalyrmple
Life at the Bottom: The Worldview That M.summary: "Here is a searing account-probably the best yet published-of life in the underclass and why it persists as it does. Theodore Dalrymple, a British psychiatrist who treats the poor in a slum hospital and a prison in England, has seemingly seen it all. Yet in listening to and observing his patients, he is continually astonished by the latest twist of depravity that exceeds even his own considerable experience."

The Limits of Partnership: U.S.-Russian.title: The Limits of Partnership: U.S.-Russian Relations in the Twenty-First Century
The Limits of Partnership: U.S.-Russian.author: Angela Stent
The Limits of Partnership: U.S.-Russian.summary: "The Limits of Partnership is a riveting narrative about U.S.-Russian relations from the Soviet collapse through the Ukraine crisis and the difficult challenges ahead. It reflects the unique perspective of an insider who is also recognized as a leading expert on this troubled relationship."

Little Brother\tCory Doctorow.title: Little Brother
Little Brother\tCory Doctorow.author: Cory Doctorow
Little Brother\tCory Doctorow.summary: "Marcus, a.k.a 'w1n5t0n,' is only seventeen years old, but he figures he already knows how the system works–and how to work the system. Smart, fast, and wise to the ways of the networked world, he has no trouble outwitting his high school's intrusive but clumsy surveillance systems."
reviews: "It's a great story about teenagers, net culture, security, activism and politics and was a lot of fun to read. It references a lot of real-life stuff like XBox hacks and ARGs and is classic Cory."
"If you're into security and privacy."

The Logic of Scientific Discovery\tKarl.title: The Logic of Scientific Discovery
The Logic of Scientific Discovery\tKarl.author: Karl Popper
The Logic of Scientific Discovery\tKarl.summary: "Described by the philosopher A.J. Ayer as a work of 'great originality and power', this book revolutionized contemporary thinking on science and knowledge. Ideas such as the now legendary doctrine of 'falsificationism' electrified the scientific community, influencing even working scientists, as well as post-war philosophy."

Loitering with Intent\tMuriel Spark.title: Loitering with Intent
Loitering with Intent\tMuriel Spark.author: Muriel Spark
Loitering with Intent\tMuriel Spark.summary: "Happily loitering about London, c. 1949, with the intent of gathering material for her writing, Fleur Talbot finds a job 'on the grubby edge of the literary world' at the very peculiar Autobiographical Association."
reviews: "Rejoicing — the very last word that appears in Loitering With Intent — captures the entire book's mood and message. A fictional counterpoint to Spark's 1992 autobiography, this novel tells how one Fleur Talbot became a woman and a writer. It's a book as irresistible as its author — a manifestation of her meticulous, confident, joyous, mischievous spirit."

The Long Goodbye\tRaymond Chandler.title: The Long Goodbye
The Long Goodbye\tRaymond Chandler.author: Raymond Chandler
The Long Goodbye\tRaymond Chandler.summary: "Marlowe befriends a down on his luck war veteran with the scars to prove it. Then he finds out that Terry Lennox has a very wealthy nymphomaniac wife, who he's divorced and re-married and who ends up dead. and now Lennox is on the lam and the cops and a crazy gangster are after Marlowe."
reviews: "Indispensable to me (both as a reader and as a writer)"

The Looming Tower: Al-Qaeda and the Road.title: The Looming Tower: Al-Qaeda and the Road to 9/11
The Looming Tower: Al-Qaeda and the Road.author: Lawrence Wright
The Looming Tower: Al-Qaeda and the Road.summary: "A gripping narrative that spans five decades, The Looming Tower explains in unprecedented detail the growth of Islamic fundamentalism, the rise of al-Qaeda, and the intelligence failures that culminated in the attacks on the World Trade Center."

Lord of the World\tRobert Benson.title: Lord of the World
Lord of the World\tRobert Benson.author: Robert Benson
Lord of the World\tRobert Benson.summary: "Robert Hugh Benson was an Anglican priest who also wrote Christian works. From the preface: 'I am perfectly aware that this is a terribly sensational book, and open to innumerable criticisms on that account, as well as on many others. But I did not know how else to express the principles I desired (and which I passionately believe to be true) except by producing their lines to a sensational point.'"

A Lover's Discourse: Fragments\tRoland B.title: A Lover's Discourse: Fragments
A Lover's Discourse: Fragments\tRoland B.author: Roland Barthes
A Lover's Discourse: Fragments\tRoland B.summary: "A Lover's Discourse, at its 1978 publication, was revolutionary: Roland Barthes made unprecedented use of the tools of structuralism to explore the whimsical phenomenon of love."

Loyalty 3.0: How Big Data and Gamificati.title: Loyalty 3.0: How Big Data and Gamification are Revolutionizing Customer and Employee Engagement
Loyalty 3.0: How Big Data and Gamificati.author: Rajat Paharia
Loyalty 3.0: How Big Data and Gamificati.summary: "Paharia shows you how to create a system powered by human motivation and digital technology that creates ongoing, persistent engagement among customers, employees, and partners."

Machete Season: The Killers in Rwanda Sp.title: Machete Season: The Killers in Rwanda Speak
Machete Season: The Killers in Rwanda Sp.author: Jean Hatzfeld
Machete Season: The Killers in Rwanda Sp.summary: "During the spring of 1994, in a tiny country called Rwanda, some 800,000 people were hacked to death, one by one, by their neighbors in a gruesome civil war. Several years later, journalist Jean Hatzfeld traveled to Rwanda to interview ten participants in the killings, eliciting extraordinary testimony from these men about the genocide they perpetrated."

Madame Bovary\tGustave Flaubert.title: Madame Bovary
Madame Bovary\tGustave Flaubert.author: Gustave Flaubert
Madame Bovary\tGustave Flaubert.summary: "This exquisite novel tells the story of one of the most compelling heroines in modern literature--Emma Bovary. Unhappily married to a devoted, clumsy provincial doctor, Emma revolts against the ordinariness of her life by pursuing voluptuous dreams of ecstasy and love."

The Making of the Atom Bomb\tRichard Rho.title: The Making of the Atom Bomb
The Making of the Atom Bomb\tRichard Rho.author: Richard Rhodes
The Making of the Atom Bomb\tRichard Rho.summary: "Twenty-five years after its initial publication, The Making of the Atomic Bomb remains the definitive history of nuclear weapons and the Manhattan Project. From the turn-of-the-century discovery of nuclear energy to the dropping of the first bombs on Japan, Richard Rhodes’s Pulitzer Prize-winning book details the science, the people, and the socio-political realities that led to the development of the atomic bomb."

The Malleus Maleficarum of Heinrich Kram.title: The Malleus Maleficarum of Heinrich Kramer and James Sprenger
The Malleus Maleficarum of Heinrich Kram.author: Heinrich Kramer
The Malleus Maleficarum of Heinrich Kram.summary: "First written in 1486 by zealous Inquisitors of the Catholic Church, The Witch Hammer came to be the witch-hunting handbook of the fifteenth century."

Man's Search for Meaning\tVictor Frankl.title: Man's Search for Meaning
Man's Search for Meaning\tVictor Frankl.author: Victor Frankl
Man's Search for Meaning\tVictor Frankl.summary: "Between 1942 and 1945 Frankl labored in four different camps, including Auschwitz, while his parents, brother, and pregnant wife perished. Based on his own experience and the experiences of others he treated later in his practice, Frankl argues that we cannot avoid suffering but we can choose how to cope with it, find meaning in it, and move forward with renewed purpose."

The Mantle of Command: FDR at War, 1941-.title: The Mantle of Command: FDR at War, 1941-1942
The Mantle of Command: FDR at War, 1941-.author: Nigel Hamilton
The Mantle of Command: FDR at War, 1941-.summary: "Based on years of archival research and interviews with the last surviving aides and Roosevelt family members, Nigel Hamilton offers a definitive account of FDR’s masterful—and underappreciated—command of the Allied war effort."

Mastering the Dynamics of Innovation\tJa.title: Mastering the Dynamics of Innovation
Mastering the Dynamics of Innovation\tJa.author: James Utterback
Mastering the Dynamics of Innovation\tJa.summary: "The author presents a compelling look at how innovation transforms industries, raising the fortunes of some firms while destroying others."
reviews: "This book opened my eyes with evidence and findings about innovation."

Maximalist: America in the World from Tr.title: Maximalist: America in the World from Truman to Obama
Maximalist: America in the World from Tr.author: Stephen Sestanovich
Maximalist: America in the World from Tr.summary: "From a writer with long and high-level experience in the U.S. government, a startling and provocative assessment of America’s global dominance. Maximalist puts the history of our foreign policy in an unexpected new light, while drawing fresh, compelling lessons for the present and future."

The Meaning Of It All: Thoughts of a Cit.title: The Meaning Of It All: Thoughts of a Citizen-Scientist
The Meaning Of It All: Thoughts of a Cit.author: Richard Feynman
The Meaning Of It All: Thoughts of a Cit.summary: "Many appreciate Richard P. Feynman’s contributions to twentieth-century physics, but few realize how engaged he was with the world around him—how deeply and thoughtfully he considered the religious, political, and social issues of his day."

Meditations on First Philosophy\tRene De.title: Meditations on First Philosophy
Meditations on First Philosophy\tRene De.author: Rene Descartes
Meditations on First Philosophy\tRene De.summary: "The book is made up of six meditations, in which Descartes first discards all belief in things that are not absolutely certain, and then tries to establish what can be known for sure."

Meditations\tMarcus Aurelius.title: Meditations
Meditations\tMarcus Aurelius.author: Marcus Aurelius
Meditations\tMarcus Aurelius.summary: "One of the world's most famous and influential books, Meditations, by the Roman emperor Marcus Aurelius (A.D. 121–180), incorporates the stoic precepts he used to cope with his life as a warrior and administrator of an empire."
reviews: "[Please recommend 5 non-fiction books that one must read.]"

Merchants of Doubt: How a Handful of Sci.title: Merchants of Doubt: How a Handful of Scientists Obscured the Truth on Issues from Tobacco Smoke to Global Warming
Merchants of Doubt: How a Handful of Sci.author: Naomi Oreskes
Merchants of Doubt: How a Handful of Sci.summary: "Merchants of Doubt was one of the most talked-about climate change books of recent years, for reasons easy to understand: It tells the controversial story of how a loose-knit group of high-level scientists and scientific advisers, with deep connections in politics and industry, ran effective campaigns to mislead the public and deny well-established scientific knowledge over four decades."
reviews: "Which will help you understand the mushrooming #ExxonKnew scandal."
"Same who tried to deny smoking deaths are denying climate change."

Metamorphosis\tFranz Kafka.title: Metamorphosis
Metamorphosis\tFranz Kafka.author: Franz Kafka
Metamorphosis\tFranz Kafka.summary: "The story begins with a traveling salesman, Gregor Samsa, waking to find himself transformed into an insect."
reviews: "One of the great themes of classical literature, the transformation of bodies into other bodies, gets a dark modern twist from Kafka."

The Metaphysical Club: A Story of Ideas.title: The Metaphysical Club: A Story of Ideas in America
The Metaphysical Club: A Story of Ideas.author: Louis Menand
The Metaphysical Club: A Story of Ideas.summary: "The Metaphysical Club was an informal group that met in Cambridge, Massachusetts, in 1872, to talk about ideas. Its members included Oliver Well Holmes, Jr., future associate justice of the United States Supreme Court; William James, the father of modern American psychology; and Charles Sanders Peirce, logician, scientist, and the founder of semiotics."

A Mind at Peace\tAhmet Hamdi Tanpinar.title: A Mind at Peace
A Mind at Peace\tAhmet Hamdi Tanpinar.author: Ahmet Hamdi Tanpinar
A Mind at Peace\tAhmet Hamdi Tanpinar.summary: "With an innate awareness of how dueling cultural mentalities can lead to the distress of divided selves, Tanpinar gauges this moment in history by masterfully portraying its register on the layered psyches of his Istanbulite characters."
reviews: "Written by the man who almost single-handedly defined the modern Turkish novel, A Mind At Peace follows a group of westernized, urban intellectuals in 1930s Istanbul as they drift through the city in a permanent state of ennui, seemingly caught between the past and the present, tradition and modernity, the East and the West."

The Mind’s Past\tMichael Gazzaniga.title: The Mind’s Past
The Mind’s Past\tMichael Gazzaniga.author: Michael Gazzaniga
The Mind’s Past\tMichael Gazzaniga.summary: "Why does the human brain insist on interpreting the world and constructing a narrative? In this ground-breaking work, Michael S. Gazzaniga, one of the world's foremost cognitive neuroscientists, shows how our mind and brain accomplish the amazing feat of constructing our past—a process clearly fraught with errors of perception, memory, and judgment."

Mindstorms: Children, Computers, And Pow.title: Mindstorms: Children, Computers, And Powerful Ideas
Mindstorms: Children, Computers, And Pow.author: Seymour Papert
Mindstorms: Children, Computers, And Pow.summary: "Mindstorms has two central themes: that children can learn to use computers in a masterful way and that learning to use computers can change the way they learn everything else."
reviews: "Papert understands developing minds, and broke all models for how children should be introduced to computers and technology."

Modelling Extremal Events: for Insurance.title: Modelling Extremal Events: for Insurance and Finance
Modelling Extremal Events: for Insurance.author: Paul Embrechts
Modelling Extremal Events: for Insurance.summary: "A reader's first impression on leafing through this book is of the large number of graphs and diagrams, used to illustrate shapes of distributions...and to show real data examples in various ways. A closer reading reveals a nice mix of theory and applications, with the copious graphical illustrations alluded to."
reviews: "The mathematics of extreme events, or the remote parts of the probability distributions, is a discipline on its own, more important than any other with respect to risk and decisions since some domains are dominated by the extremes: for the class of subexponential (and of course for the subclass of power laws) the tails ARE the story. Now this book is the bible for the field."

Models.Behaving.Badly: Why Confusing Ill.title: Models.Behaving.Badly: Why Confusing Illusion with Reality Can Lead to Disaster, on Wall Street and in Life
Models.Behaving.Badly: Why Confusing Ill.author: Emanuel Derman
Models.Behaving.Badly: Why Confusing Ill.summary: "Quants, physicists working on Wall Street as quantitative analysts, have been widely blamed for triggering financial crises with their complex mathematical models. Their formulas were meant to allow Wall Street to prosper without risk. But in this penetrating insider’s look at the recent economic collapse, Emanuel Derman—former head quant at Goldman Sachs—explains the collision between mathematical modeling and economics and what makes financial models so dangerous."
reviews: "[Derman] convincingly establishes the difference between model and theory and shows why attempts to model financial markets can never be genuinely scientific. It vindicates those of us who hold that financial modeling is neither practical nor scientific. Exceedingly readable."

The Monkey Wrench Gang\tEdward Abbey.title: The Monkey Wrench Gang
The Monkey Wrench Gang\tEdward Abbey.author: Edward Abbey
The Monkey Wrench Gang\tEdward Abbey.summary: "Ex-Green Beret George Hayduke has returned from war to find his beloved southwestern desert threatened by industrial development."
reviews: "[Which book (past or present) has given you the most hope?] The Monkey Wrench Gang"

Essays\tMichel de Montaigne.title: Essays
Essays\tMichel de Montaigne.author: Michel de Montaigne
Essays\tMichel de Montaigne.summary: "Reflections by the creator of the essay form display the humane, skeptical, humorous, and honest views of Montaigne, revealing his thoughts on sexuality, religion, cannibals, intellectuals, and other unexpected themes."

The Moon Is a Harsh Mistress\tRobert Hei.title: The Moon Is a Harsh Mistress
The Moon Is a Harsh Mistress\tRobert Hei.author: Robert Heinlein
The Moon Is a Harsh Mistress\tRobert Hei.summary: "The Moon is a Harsh Mistress is one of the high points of modern science fiction, a novel bursting with politics, humanity, passion, innovative technical speculation, and a firm belief in the pursuit of human freedom."
reviews: "I think the Foundation series from Asimov is like one of the best ever, and the books of Arthur C. Clarke and Heinlein, those are like probably the three best sci-fi authors [..] I think [this is] Heinlein's best book, honestly."

Mortal Questions\tThomas Nagel.title: Mortal Questions
Mortal Questions\tThomas Nagel.author: Thomas Nagel
Mortal Questions\tThomas Nagel.summary: "Thomas Nagel's Mortal Questions explores some fundamental issues concerning the meaning, nature and value of human life."

Mortality\tChristopher Hitchens.title: Mortality
Mortality\tChristopher Hitchens.author: Christopher Hitchens
Mortality\tChristopher Hitchens.summary: "In this riveting account of his [fatal bout with esophageal cancer], Hitchens poignantly describes the torments of illness, discusses its taboos, and explores how disease transforms experience and changes our relationship to the world around us."

How Much Land Does a Man Need? and Other.title: How Much Land Does a Man Need? and Other Stories
How Much Land Does a Man Need? and Other.author: Leo Tolstoy
How Much Land Does a Man Need? and Other.summary: "These short works, ranging from Tolstoy's earliest tales to the brilliant title story, are rich in the insights and passion that characterize all of his explorations in love, war, courage, and civilization."

The Mystery of Consciousness\tJohn Searl.title: The Mystery of Consciousness
The Mystery of Consciousness\tJohn Searl.author: John Searle
The Mystery of Consciousness\tJohn Searl.summary: "It has long been one of the most fundamental problems of philosophy, and it is now, John Searle writes, 'the most important problem in the biological sciences': What is consciousness? Is my inner awareness of myself something separate from my body?"

Mythologies\tRoland Barthes.title: Mythologies
Mythologies\tRoland Barthes.author: Roland Barthes
Mythologies\tRoland Barthes.summary: ""[Mythologies] illustrates the beautiful generosity of Barthes's progressive interest in the meaning (his word is signification) of practically everything around him, not only the books and paintings of high art, but also the slogans, trivia, toys, food, and popular rituals (cruises, striptease, eating, wrestling matches) of contemporary life."

The Net Delusion: The Dark Side of Inter.title: The Net Delusion: The Dark Side of Internet Freedom
The Net Delusion: The Dark Side of Inter.author: Evgeny Morozov
The Net Delusion: The Dark Side of Inter.summary: "For all of the talk in the West about the power of the Internet to democratize societies, regimes in Iran and China are as stable and repressive as ever. Social media sites have been used there to entrench dictators and threaten dissidents, making it harder—not easier—to promote democracy."
reviews: "A well-argued brief that challenges our widely held belief that social media and cybertechnology are enhancing democracy, human rights, and freedoms around the world. Far from helping, Morozov very compellingly argues, they’re hindering."

The New Atheism: Taking a Stand for Scie.title: The New Atheism: Taking a Stand for Science and Reason
The New Atheism: Taking a Stand for Scie.author: Victor Stenger
The New Atheism: Taking a Stand for Scie.summary: "In this new book, Victor J. Stenger reviews and expands upon the principles of New Atheism and answers many of its critics. He demonstrates in detail that naturalism—the view that all of reality is reducible to matter and nothing else—is sufficient to explain everything we observe in the universe, from the most distant galaxies to the inner workings of the brain that result in the phenomenon of mind."

The New Financial Order: Risk in the 21s.title: The New Financial Order: Risk in the 21st Century
The New Financial Order: Risk in the 21s.author: Rober Shiller
The New Financial Order: Risk in the 21s.summary: "Shiller describes six fundamental ideas for using modern information technology and advanced financial theory to temper basic risks that have been ignored by risk management institutions--risks to the value of our jobs and our homes, to the vitality of our communities, and to the very stability of national economies."
reviews: "Robert Shiller has the remarkable ability to think independently and the courage to propose ideas that to middlebrow thinkers may sound speculative."

Nisa: The Life and Words of a !Kung Woma.title: Nisa: The Life and Words of a !Kung Woman
Nisa: The Life and Words of a !Kung Woma.author: Marjorie Shostak
Nisa: The Life and Words of a !Kung Woma.summary: "This book is the story of the life of Nisa, a member of the !Kung tribe of hunter-gatherers from southern Africa’s Kalahari desert."
reviews: "A woman anthropologist reports the vivid life stories told to her by a woman hunter-gatherer of Africa's Kalahari Desert as the latter discovers sex, outlives some of her own children, and grows older"

Word and Object (Studies in Communicatio.title: Word and Object (Studies in Communication)
Word and Object (Studies in Communicatio.author: Willard Van Orman Quine
Word and Object (Studies in Communicatio.summary: "Language is a social art. In acquiring it we have to depend entirely on intersubjectively available cues as to what to say and when."
reviews: "It not only convinced me that I should become a philosopher, it convinced me that I should try to be the same kind of philosopher Quine was. I would never have been a philosopher without his example."

Objectivity, Relativism, and Truth: Phil.title: Objectivity, Relativism, and Truth: Philosophical Papers
Objectivity, Relativism, and Truth: Phil.author: Richard Rorty
Objectivity, Relativism, and Truth: Phil.summary: "In this volume Rorty offers a Deweyan account of objectivity as intersubjectivity, one that drops claims about universal validity and instead focuses on utility for the purposes of a community."

The Old Ways: A Journey on Foot \tRobert.title: The Old Ways: A Journey on Foot
The Old Ways: A Journey on Foot \tRobert.author: Robert MacFarlane
The Old Ways: A Journey on Foot \tRobert.summary: "In this exquisitely written book, which folds together natural history, cartography, geology, and literature, Robert Macfarlane sets off to follow the ancient routes that crisscross both the landscape of the British Isles and its waters and territories beyond. The result is an immersive, enthralling exploration of the voices that haunt old paths and the stories our tracks tell."
reviews: "Powerfully evocative and beautifully written, The Old Ways is a vividly ruminative travelogue, including among its many delights a wonderfully perceptive section on the poet of pathways and roads without ends, Edward Thomas."

One Summer: America, 1927\tBill Bryson.title: One Summer: America, 1927
One Summer: America, 1927\tBill Bryson.author: Bill Bryson
One Summer: America, 1927\tBill Bryson.summary: "The summer of 1927 began with Charles Lindbergh crossing the Atlantic. Meanwhile, Babe Ruth was closing in on the home run record. In Newark, New Jersey, Alvin 'Shipwreck' Kelly sat atop a flagpole for twelve days, and in Chicago, the gangster Al Capone was tightening his grip on bootlegging. The first true 'talking picture,' Al Jolson’s The Jazz Singer, was filmed, forever changing the motion picture industry."
reviews: "A charming account of the events of 1927 in America, is told with his usual dry wit."

The Opposing Shore\tJulien Gracq.title: The Opposing Shore
The Opposing Shore\tJulien Gracq.author: Julien Gracq
The Opposing Shore\tJulien Gracq.summary: "A mysterious and retiring figure, Gracq characteristically refused the Goncourt, France's most distinguished literary prize, when it was awarded to him in 1951 for this book. Set in a fictitious Mediterranean port city, The Opposing Shore is the first-person account of a young aristocrat sent to observe the activities of a naval base."
reviews: "The style is lapidary with remarkable precision; it has texture, wealth of details, and creates a mesmerizing athmosphere. Once you enter it, you are stuck there."

The Origin of Species\tCharles Darwin.title: The Origin of Species
The Origin of Species\tCharles Darwin.author: Charles Darwin
The Origin of Species\tCharles Darwin.summary: "Darwin’s reasoned, documented arguments carefully advance his theory of natural selection and his assertion that species were not created all at once by a divine hand but started with a few simple forms that mutated and adapted over time."
reviews: "He permanently demolished the nearly universal supposition that divine intervention is needed to explain the capabilities of plants and animals. His book works as a polemic in part because it is wonderfully readable."

Our Final Invention: Artificial Intellig.title: Our Final Invention: Artificial Intelligence and the End of the Human Era
Our Final Invention: Artificial Intellig.author: James Barrat
Our Final Invention: Artificial Intellig.summary: "Through profiles of tech visionaries, industry watchdogs, and groundbreaking AI systems, Our Final Invention explores the perils of the heedless pursuit of advanced AI. Until now, human intelligence has had no rival. Can we coexist with beings whose intelligence dwarfs our own? And will they allow us to?"
reviews: "While on the subject of AI risk, [this book] is also worth reading."

A Parenthesis in Eternity: Living the My.title: A Parenthesis in Eternity: Living the Mystical Life
A Parenthesis in Eternity: Living the My.author: Joel S. Goldsmith
A Parenthesis in Eternity: Living the My.summary: "Goldsmith explains the Circle of Eternity--the basis of his approach to mysticism--and tells how to transcend the 'parenthesis' of our everyday lives that falls between birth and death."

Passionate Presence: Seven Qualities of.title: Passionate Presence: Seven Qualities of Awakened Awareness
Passionate Presence: Seven Qualities of.author: Catherine Ingram
Passionate Presence: Seven Qualities of.summary: "Learn the seven ways to tap into a state of pure joy, at any time, with the spiritual teacher Catherine Ingram. When we deeply relax, free from the stories the past, present and future, a great passion for life emerges, along with an awakened intelligence."

The Pattern On The Stone: The Simple Ide.title: The Pattern On The Stone: The Simple Ideas That Make Computers Work
The Pattern On The Stone: The Simple Ide.author: Danny Hillis
The Pattern On The Stone: The Simple Ide.summary: "Most people are baffled by how computers work and assume that they will never understand them. What they don’t realize—and what Daniel Hillis’s short book brilliantly demonstrates—is that computers’ seemingly complex operations can be broken down into a few simple parts that perform the same simple procedures over and over again."
reviews: "A brilliant introduction to the ideas behind computers."

The Pema Chodron Audio Collection: Pure.title: The Pema Chodron Audio Collection: Pure Meditation:Good Medicine:From Fear to Fearlessness
The Pema Chodron Audio Collection: Pure.author: Pema Chodron
The Pema Chodron Audio Collection: Pure.summary: "Pema Chodron, one of the West's most beloved teachers of Buddhism, makes the Tibetan vajrayana tradition accessible in today's world."
reviews: "She is a Buddhist nun who has a monastery in Nova Scotia [...] We are falling, falling, with nothing to hold on to and nothing to slow us down. The good news is there is no ground to land on."

Pensees\tPascal.title: Pensees
Pensees\tPascal.author: Pascal
Pensees\tPascal.summary: "The Pensees is a collection of philosohical fragments, notes and essays in which Pascal explores the contradictions of human nature in pscyhological, social, metaphysical and - above all - theological terms. Mankind emerges from Pascal's analysis as a wretched and desolate creature within an impersonal universe, but who can be transformed through faith in God's grace."

The Peripheral\tWilliam Gibson.title: The Peripheral
The Peripheral\tWilliam Gibson.author: William Gibson
The Peripheral\tWilliam Gibson.summary: "Where Flynne and her brother, Burton, live, jobs outside the drug business are rare."
reviews: "Gibson's novel describes a digital economic landscape only a notch or two more extreme than our own, and plays out a scenario detailing what happens when we get all the tech we want, but it's all geared toward extracting value from us."

The Phenomenology of the Mind\tGeorg Wil.title: The Phenomenology of the Mind
The Phenomenology of the Mind\tGeorg Wil.author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
The Phenomenology of the Mind\tGeorg Wil.summary: "In The Phenomenology of Mind, idealist philosopher Georg Hegel (1770–1831) defied the traditional epistemological distinction of objective from subjective and developed his own dialectical alternative."

Philosophical Explanations\tRobert Nozic.title: Philosophical Explanations
Philosophical Explanations\tRobert Nozic.author: Robert Nozick
Philosophical Explanations\tRobert Nozic.summary: "In this highly original work, Robert Nozick develops new views on philosophy's central topics and weaves them into a unified philosophical perspective."

Philosophical Investigations\tLudwig Wit.title: Philosophical Investigations
Philosophical Investigations\tLudwig Wit.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
Philosophical Investigations\tLudwig Wit.summary: "Written by one of the century's truly great thinkers, Ludwig Wittgenstein's Philosophical Investigations is a remarkable--and surprisingly approachable--collection of insights, statements, and nearly displayed thinking habits of the philosopher's work on language, symbols, categories, and a host of other topics. Organized into nearly 700 short observations, this book is a treasure trove for anyone who needs to think carefully about objects, categories, and symbols, especially in relation to structured logic applications in computer programming."

The Physiology of Truth: Neuroscience an.title: The Physiology of Truth: Neuroscience and Human Knowledge
The Physiology of Truth: Neuroscience an.author: JP Changeux
The Physiology of Truth: Neuroscience an.summary: "In this wide-ranging book, one of the boldest thinkers in modern neuroscience confronts an ancient philosophical problem: can we know the world as it really is?"

Pnin\tVladimir Nabakov.title: Pnin
Pnin\tVladimir Nabakov.author: Vladimir Nabakov
Pnin\tVladimir Nabakov.summary: "Pnin is a professor of Russian at an American college who takes the wrong train to deliver a lecture in a language he cannot master."
reviews: "Timofey Pavlovich Pnin, a nontenured Russian academic at an elite American university, is a modern, more complicated version of Don Quixote, tackling imaginary windmills and real frauds and academic shysters. Pnin and Lolita are the two most poignant and memorable of Nabokov's characters."

Politicide: The Real Legacy of Ariel Sha.title: Politicide: The Real Legacy of Ariel Sharon
Politicide: The Real Legacy of Ariel Sha.author: Baruch Kimmerling
Politicide: The Real Legacy of Ariel Sha.summary: "Ariel Sharon is one of the most experienced, shrewd and frightening leaders of the new millennium. Despite being found both directly and indirectly responsible for acts considered war crimes under international law, he became Prime Minister of Israel, a political victory he won by provoking the Palestinians into a new uprising, the second intifada."

The Portable Atheist: Essential Readings.title: The Portable Atheist: Essential Readings for the Nonbeliever
The Portable Atheist: Essential Readings.author: Christopher Hitchens
The Portable Atheist: Essential Readings.summary: "Christopher Hitchens continues to make the case for a splendidly godless universe in this first-ever gathering of the influential voices--past and present--that have shaped his side of the current (and raging) God/no-god debate."

Power and Plenty: Trade, War, and the Wo.title: Power and Plenty: Trade, War, and the World Economy in the Second Millennium
Power and Plenty: Trade, War, and the Wo.author: Ronald Findlay
Power and Plenty: Trade, War, and the Wo.summary: "International trade has shaped the modern world, yet until now no single book has been available for both economists and general readers that traces the history of the international economy from its earliest beginnings to the present day. Power and Plenty fills this gap, providing the first full account of world trade and development over the course of the last millennium."
reviews: "What the book shows is that the ebb and flow of globalisation have been intimately linked with military conflict, with the rise of political power, with competition among the great powers. And we miss a lot of the picture if we don’t understand that behind economic globalisation of any kind is a certain structure of political power."

Primates and Philosophers: How Morality.title: Primates and Philosophers: How Morality Evolved
Primates and Philosophers: How Morality.author: Frans de Waal
Primates and Philosophers: How Morality.summary: "Can virtuous behavior be explained by nature, and not by human rational choice?"

The Prince\tNiccolo Machiavelli.title: The Prince
The Prince\tNiccolo Machiavelli.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
The Prince\tNiccolo Machiavelli.summary: "For over four hundred years, The Prince has been the basic handbook of politics, statesmanship, and power. Written by a Florentine nobleman whose name has become a synonym for crafty plotting, it is a fascinating political and social document, as pertinent today as when it first appeared."

The Principles of Psychology, Vol. 1\tWi.title: The Principles of Psychology, Vol. 1
The Principles of Psychology, Vol. 1\tWi.author: William James
The Principles of Psychology, Vol. 1\tWi.summary: "Stream of thought, time perception, memory, experimental methods — these are only some of the concerns of a work that was years ahead of its time and is still valid, interesting and useful."

Probability 1\tAmir Aczel.title: Probability 1
Probability 1\tAmir Aczel.author: Amir Aczel
Probability 1\tAmir Aczel.summary: "The existence of intelligent alien life is not only probable, but certain, and Amir Aczel proves it in this eye-opening and controversial work."

Probability Theory\tSRS Varadhan.title: Probability Theory
Probability Theory\tSRS Varadhan.author: SRS Varadhan
Probability Theory\tSRS Varadhan.summary: "This volume presents topics in probability theory covered during a first-year graduate course given at the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences."
reviews: "I know which books I value when I end up buying a second copy after losing the first one. This book gives a complete overview of the basis of probability theory with some grounding in measure theory, and presents the main proofs."

The Problem Of The Soul: Two Visions Of.title: The Problem Of The Soul: Two Visions Of Mind And How To Reconcile Them
The Problem Of The Soul: Two Visions Of.author: Owen Flanagan
The Problem Of The Soul: Two Visions Of.summary: "If brains and bodies undergo relentless change, how can our identities be constant? The Problem of the Soul shows the way out of these paradoxes [of the mind]."

The Al Qaeda Reader: The Essential Texts.title: The Al Qaeda Reader: The Essential Texts of Osama Bin Laden's Terrorist Organization
The Al Qaeda Reader: The Essential Texts.author: Raymond Ibrahim
The Al Qaeda Reader: The Essential Texts.summary: "Despite our tendency to dismiss Islamic extremism as profoundly irrational, al-Qaeda is not without a coherent body of beliefs.  Like other totalitarian movements, the movement’s leaders have rationalized their brutality in a number of published treatises."

Radiant Cool: A Novel Theory of Consciou.title: Radiant Cool: A Novel Theory of Consciousness
Radiant Cool: A Novel Theory of Consciou.author: Dan Lloyd
Radiant Cool: A Novel Theory of Consciou.summary: "Professor Grue is dead (or is he?). When graduate student/sleuth Miranda Sharpe discovers him slumped over his keyboard, she does the sensible thing--she grabs her dissertation and runs."
reviews: "This is a fine example of what an empirically well-informed and deeply imaginative philosopher can do to open up imaginations to some of the new scientific ideas about consciousness."

Reasons and Persons\tDerek Parfit.title: Reasons and Persons
Reasons and Persons\tDerek Parfit.author: Derek Parfit
Reasons and Persons\tDerek Parfit.summary: "Challenging, with several powerful arguments, some of our deepest beliefs about rationality, morality, and personal identity, Derek Parfit claims that we have a false view about our own nature."
reviews: "Parfit's penetrating thought and spare prose make this one of the most exciting, if challenging, works by a contemporary philosopher."

The Record of the Paper: How the New Yor.title: The Record of the Paper: How the New York Times Misreports US Foreign Policy
The Record of the Paper: How the New Yor.author: Richard A. Falk
The Record of the Paper: How the New Yor.summary: "In this meticulously researched study, Howard Friel and Richard Falk reveal how the [New York] Times has consistently misreported major US foreign policy issues, including the bombing of North Vietnam in response to the Tonkin Gulf and Pleiku incidents in 1964-65, the Reagan administration’s policy toward the Sandinista government of Nicaragua in the 1980s, the 2002 military coup that briefly overthrew Hugo Chavez, Venezuela’s elected president, and the Bush administration’s 2003 invasion of Iraq."

The Mars Trilogy \tKim Stanley Robinson.title: The Mars Trilogy
The Mars Trilogy \tKim Stanley Robinson.author: Kim Stanley Robinson
The Mars Trilogy \tKim Stanley Robinson.summary: "For centuries, the barren, desolate landscape of the red planet has beckoned to humankind. Now a group of one hundred colonists begins a mission whose ultimate goal is to transform Mars into a more Earthlike planet."
reviews: "A very long book about how to make communities work (or not)."

Reefer Madness: Sex, Drugs, and Cheap La.title: Reefer Madness: Sex, Drugs, and Cheap Labor in the American Black Market
Reefer Madness: Sex, Drugs, and Cheap La.author: Eric Schlosser
Reefer Madness: Sex, Drugs, and Cheap La.summary: "America’s black market is much larger than we realize, and it affects us all deeply, whether or not we smoke pot, rent a risqué video, or pay our kids’ nannies in cash. In Reefer Madness the best-selling author of Fast Food Nation turns his exacting eye on the underbelly of the American marketplace and its far-reaching influence on our society."

Reflections on the Revolution In Europe:.title: Reflections on the Revolution In Europe: Immigration, Islam and the West
Reflections on the Revolution In Europe:.author: Christopher Caldwell
Reflections on the Revolution In Europe:.summary: "In light of cultural crises such as the Danish cartoon controversy and the terrorist attack on the Charlie Hebdo newspaper in Paris, Christopher Caldwell’s incisive perspective has never been more timely or indispensible. Reflections on the Revolution in Europe is destined to become the classic work on how Muslim immigration permanently reshaped the West."

The Remembered Present: A Biological The.title: The Remembered Present: A Biological Theory of Consciousness
The Remembered Present: A Biological The.author: Gerald Edelman
The Remembered Present: A Biological The.summary: "Nobel laureate Gerald M. Edelman proposes a comprehensive theory of consciousness in The Remembered Present. Integrating findings generated by the recent explosive growth in the neurosciences with current knowledge of anatomy, cell biology, and psychology, Edelman has been able to construct a detailed model of how we become aware of our own existence."

The Republic\tPlato.title: The Republic
The Republic\tPlato.author: Plato
The Republic\tPlato.summary: "Plato's most famous work and one of the most important books ever written on the subject of philosophy and political theory, The Republic is a fictional dialogue between Socrates and other various Athenians and foreigners which examines the meaning of justice."
reviews: “So much of the most profound thought in the West is a serious wrestling with issues raised by this book.”

The Return of History and the End of Dre.title: The Return of History and the End of Dreams
The Return of History and the End of Dre.author: Robert Kagan
The Return of History and the End of Dre.summary: "Hopes for a new peaceful international order after the end of the Cold War have been dashed by sobering realities: Great powers are once again competing for honor and influence."

The Road to Reality: A Complete Guide to.title: The Road to Reality: A Complete Guide to the Laws of the Universe
The Road to Reality: A Complete Guide to.author: Richard Penrose
The Road to Reality: A Complete Guide to.summary: "Roger Penrose, one of the most accomplished scientists of our time, presents the only comprehensive and comprehensible account of the physics of the universe."

Collected Maxims and Other Reflections\t.title: Collected Maxims and Other Reflections
Collected Maxims and Other Reflections\t.author: La Rochefoucauld
Collected Maxims and Other Reflections\t.summary: "After abandoning politics when he was about forty, François, duc de La Rochefoucauld (1613-1680) began to write down his maxims, which were first published in book form in 1665. Poetic, ironic, and frequently humorous, his wise observations can also be blunt and brutally candid."

Ruthless Criticism: New Perspectives in.title: Ruthless Criticism: New Perspectives in US Communications History
Ruthless Criticism: New Perspectives in.author: Robert McChesney
Ruthless Criticism: New Perspectives in.summary: "Ruthless Criticism offers perspectives and subjects largely outside traditional historiography. It broadens the concept of media history to include lesser-studied media, and offers alternative interpretations of traditional media."

The Intel Trinity: How Robert Noyce, Gor.author: Michael Malone

An Introduction to Realistic Philosophy\.author: John Wild
reviews: "This book introduced me to the profundity of Aristotle. Virtue is the control of the appetites by right reason, the formation of good habits, or as my brother James once summarized it, 'Virtue is knowing what you really want.'"

Islandia\tAustin Tappan Wright.title: Islandia
Islandia\tAustin Tappan Wright.author: Austin Tappan Wright
reviews: "A utopian novel written in the 1930s, about an imaginary country where technology has not yet hastened the pace of life, and where people find time to nurture relationships and the land they live on."

Jesus Through the Centuries: His Place i.title: Jesus Through the Centuries: His Place in the History of Culture
Jesus Through the Centuries: His Place i.author: Jaroslav Pelikan

Judgment Under Uncertainty: Heuristics a.author: Daniel Kahneman

The Kelly Capital Growth Investment Crit.author: Leonard MacLean
reviews: "Buy 2 copies, just in case you lose one. This book has more meat than any other book in decision theory, economics, finance, etc…"

Leaps of Faith:Science, Miracles, and th.title: Leaps of Faith:Science, Miracles, and the Search for Supernatural Consolation
Leaps of Faith:Science, Miracles, and th.author: Nicholas Humphrey
reviews: "A trenchant and imaginative look at superstition and unreason."

The Little Prince\tAntoine de Saint-Exup.title: The Little Prince
The Little Prince\tAntoine de Saint-Exup.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
reviews: "Ever since I first discovered The Little Prince as an adolescent, I have carried a copy with me across the continents. As they say farewell, the Fox tells the Little Prince, 'One sees clearly only with the heart. Anything essential is invisible to the eye.' That short sentence for me captures the essence of literature and art.

From a Logical Point of View\tWillard Va.title: From a Logical Point of View
From a Logical Point of View\tWillard Va.author: Willard Van Orman Quine

The Lord of the Rings\tJRR Tolkien.title: The Lord of the Rings

Makers: The New Industrial Revolution \t.author: Chris Anderson
reviews: "If you're into 3D printing."

The Man Who Sold the Moon and Orphans of.title: The Man Who Sold the Moon and Orphans of the Sky
The Man Who Sold the Moon and Orphans of.author: Robert Heinlein
reviews: "Just a brilliant 50-year-old vision that is just as relevant today."

Mark Twain's Weapons of Satire: Anti-Imp.title: Mark Twain's Weapons of Satire: Anti-Imperialist Writings on the Philippine-American War
Mark Twain's Weapons of Satire: Anti-Imp.author: Mark Twain

The Martian\tAndy Weir.title: The Martian
The Martian\tAndy Weir.author: Andy Weir
reviews: "I loved the fact that the hero never once implies that it’s courage, spirit and faith that saves him — as so many modern books and films would do — just lots of practical tinkering and problem-solving: Science the crap out of it."

Mathematics: Its Content, Methods and Me.title: Mathematics: Its Content, Methods and Meaning
Mathematics: Its Content, Methods and Me.author: A. D. Aleksandrov
reviews: "There is something admirable about the school of the Russians: they are thinkers doing math, with remarkable clarity, minimal formalism, and total absence of unnecessary pedantry one finds in more modern texts (in the post Bourbaki era)."

The Meaning of Culture\tJohn Cowper Powy.title: The Meaning of Culture
The Meaning of Culture\tJohn Cowper Powy.author: John Cowper Powys
reviews: "John Cowper Powys makes the point that the difference between education and culture is that culture is the incorporation of music, art, literature, and philosophy not just into your library or your CV but into who you are. He talks too about the interplay of culture and life, the way that what we read can enrich what we experience, and what we experience can enrich what we read."

Mohandas K. Gandhi, Autobiography: The S.title: Mohandas K. Gandhi, Autobiography: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
Mohandas K. Gandhi, Autobiography: The S.author: Mahatma Gandhi

My Stroke of Insight: A Brain Scientist'.title: My Stroke of Insight: A Brain Scientist's Personal Journey
My Stroke of Insight: A Brain Scientist'.author: Jill Bolte Taylor

Narrow Roads of Gene Land: The Collected.author: W.D. Hamilton

National Insecurity: American Leadership.title: National Insecurity: American Leadership in an Age of Fear
National Insecurity: American Leadership.author: David Rothkopf

The Nature of the Physical World\tAS Edd.author: AS Eddington

Nature Via Nurture: Genes, Experience, a.author: Matt Ridley
